Blog.post: Today when the work day was done, the outside was pure paradise. The sun had come through the clouds and the rain had vanished.Instead of the usual muggy, sticky weather that we are so blessed to have here, someone finally said that enough was enough and gave us a breeze that would take your breath away. And thats how my evening began... Having dinner cooked for you, is above and beyond the call of duty. And it was so good, everything fit.The taste was arousingly exotic. And then as soon as i could look up, there he was, prepared, Jeff Buckley. We watched the whole concert. And with song by song it was perfect. There was a nice cool breeze coming from the windows that entered in the house. The antique lamp and the candles gave off the yellow-gold light, and i knew that it just could not get any better. The-light- it was so right, so percise. I thank you for nights such as these.....

Today I feel a feeling that comes along ever so often, it is the feeling of happyness, but to where you don't have to smile so often. Its not a blah, but a feeling of peace, a feeling of comfort. The feeling of the cool wind blowing through the hair and slightly across the face. Needless to say, its nice. Last night i had a wonderful time. We went to eat and to the comedy club. We always have fun at the comedy house, because even if the show were to hold no laughter, we would somehow create our own. And that too me is worth much more than the show itself. I have come to realize that simple times are coming to be the best times that i hold dearly in my heart. The times that we will sit and talk, and make jokes that only us would laugh at, over a wonderful cup of coffee. Or the times that we sit in silence, and let the power of music. I am a true believer that moments like this can only be shared my similar souls. And knowingly, that it is hard to find, i take it as a gift that is given to me every single day. He seems to be more pleasant towards me in the passing days, and that relaxes me. We are floating on the same cloud that i hope never touches the ground, for this is absolute perfection

This is the start of starting over..... I neglected the mind to write the thoughts of the me that I am thinking of. The writing will continue once more for the feeling of freeing the mind is peaceful. In here I am everything that I need to be. In here I can say the things that perhaps I would not dare say on the outside. In here my true thoughts and feelings are revealed. So here we go, another month, another day, another time.... The world has taken on so many changes, 10% of the people who live here, are now acting a little different, and the stock market is just about where it left off. Its a shame, in one year the world has rotated right back to about where it left off. Things don't change, because normally people do not. My money situation has currently brought me to a halt, and has opened my eyes. Of course the reality of my own day by day usage was brought up by a certain someone. Its funny that I will put something off for so long, but it takes one time for him to say it, and IM right on that idea. What do you call that? And better yet, Why does that happen? I guess it just ends up making sense. I am planning a night out with him.On Thursday.. IM hoping that he ends up enjoying himself, and has fun. I will not tell him where I plan on taking him, but he does get to pick the restaurant. And who knows, I might end up picking that too. Details I know that you want to know, but of course its not Thursday yet, stay tuned.

"Oh, God, I know no joy as great as a moment of rushing into a new love, no ecstasy like that of a new love. I swim in the sky; I float; my body is full of flowers, flowers with fingers giving me acute, acute caresses, sparks, jewels, quivers of joy, dizziness, such dizziness. Music inside of one, drunkenness. Only closing the eyes and remembering, and the hunger, the hunger for more, more, the great hunger, the voracious hunger, and thirst." (Anais Nin- May 30, 1934)
The weather has continued to treat us with simple cool breezes, and warm sunshine. The weather on the inside however, is do for a change.

How could i forget........ This past weekend, Jason invited me to go with him too see his buddy Rick again. This would be a moving trip, seeing how he is moving into his new house. We get there, and there are numourus people outside, Jason and I just look at each other. We get out of the car, and the Rickster sees us. His buddy J! The smile that came over his face was fantastic. So we hopped into the crowd and helped out. Hours later we are still helping, and with amazement we are still smiling. We loved being there, it was great. Ricks new house was quite awsome. The yard has so much that you could do with it. And the house just seemed to fit them better. They had a wonderful front porch decked out with a swing. One thing that i loved was the 2 huge car garage. The breeze was nice, as we watched Ricks kids play with their grandparents. It was a great trip, i would love to do it again. And i hope that we will.................hehe Oh yea, J let me drive the HONDA all the way back to my doorstep, he rocks!

My moods have become quite muffled here recently. The people around me are confusing. They jump from one mood to the next without taking a breath. I seem to never get to the point where i can please them all at once. But i guess if i could, life would be much too simple. So i walk on pins and needles with a smile, hoping that they seem to wanna smile back. Turning the page........ I get to go see amy this coming up weekend. I cant wait too go. IT will be a fun trip, going there and hanging out. Mabye we will be able to do more things than we did last time. I sure hope that J and I dont get mad at each other, that would make for a rotton trip, and either of us like to give in. J tends to judge me quick, or pop off remarks that hurt my feelings. For 9 hours there and back, that totals up too 18 hours that dead silence can occur from being pissed at one another, and that would fucking suck. I can only hope for the best.................

I have become very lazy when it comes to this..... This past weekend J and I went to Kentucky to see Amy. It was a very nice trip, the only bad part was coming back. The drive was long and we were beat! We got too meet Amys new boyfriend. He was very nice and J and i hope that he stays around. The last couple of days here has been cloudy and rainy. Im very tired of the rain and hope that it hits the road soon. There have been quite alot of people leaving the Parks and Tourism circut. Mabye its an conspiracy, who knows. This October i am wanting to buy a pumpkin and do some really cool carving on it, and post it up on the front porch. That would be cool. Last year i bought a Scarecrow to put in the front yard. It was nice, i love to decorate for the season. I think that my tree will stay the same as last year. It was purple! It was very cool....... I want to get Mika a stocking as well, she deserves one. It will be hard for me to try and figure out what to get J for Xmas. I guess i need to start thinking about it now, before it gets too late. I mean i know things that i can get him, but (ahem) in my budget is the problem. I need to keep my eyes open for casual hints.

I did something that was long overdue, and i made myself make time to do it. This past weekend i went too see my Sister, and her baby. I dont call, i just hop in the car and drive over there and hope that she is home. So i pull up and get out, and she comes outside. The look on her face made my day. She was so happy to see me. So we ended up going to the pumpkin patch and picking out some pumpkins. It was alot of fun, and im glad that i did it. Mabye it wont be so long before i do it next time. J is going with Eric this weekend to pick up Erics new Corvette. They are going all the way to Virginia.(13 hours) I will miss him this weekend......... I would love to go, but with Ken starting his new job, my paycheck is the only one coming in, plus the fact that there has been a Holiday, my check will be coming in a day late. So there is no way that i could afford to go..God i want too though. I dont want him to make the trip back alone, and i would want him to be there for me if i had too do that. And i really want too be, but i just cant this time, i just cant... untill the next time....

XMAS!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!1 Is so right around the corner. I love this time of year. This year i will be able to go home for Christmas, and that excites me. Home, the vision of home is a warm feeling. My moms smile, the food being cooked and a fire in the fireplace. I love home, i miss home. With each year it is getting harder and harder to be so far away from my mom. But most of my life i have been independent, so i have never run home for assistance. I hold her so close to me, and dance on her every word. She is my light. This year i have someone new to buy for. I thought that J would be hard to buy for, but he really isnt. I guess with both of us being broke about 99% percent of the time, there are quite a few things that we would not mind having! One of the things about christmas that i do like, is buying presents for everyone. I love to surprise people or see the look on their faces. That seems to be my total satisfaction. I love the wrapping, and the detail that i can go into in doing so. Even though they will be ripped apart, its still awsome. The wonderful decorations everywhere, people bundled, and the whole soft image of the holidays. I love christmas music and im a huge fan of lights. One thing that i remember, is on christmas eve about 11 or so in the evening, Mom and i would drive around too see the lights one last time. But in the mist of doing so, we would see moms and dads sneaking presents in from their cars. It was awsome, and is a fond memory in my heart. On a darker note, people in this world can be very selfish. And i work with a couple of the worlds finest. Yes, every once and awhile it is your right to be so. Dont bite the hand that could help you out later..... But all in all, these last couple of days have been very good on the mind side. Some of my problems have been lifted by the kindness of one. Im very glad that i do not feel like i did about 2 days ago. That was a really rough time for me, even though i am not fully over it.

"To be nobody but yourself-in a world which is doing its best night and day to make you everybody else- means to fight the hardest battle- any human being can fight-and never stop fighting" E.E. Cumming Yesterday like today is an absolute mess. The outside world is cold wet and rainy, and the furious wind has not let up. The work day was horror from the start. A grumble of passing words were applied to him and I. And i went home. When i got home last night, i took off my clothes, popped in Jeff Buckley (Grace) and soaked in a hot bath. Funny how i think that a bath will cure all my stress and problems. I sat in the bath and stared up at he celing, i tossed and turned in the bath like you would a sleepless night. I have sunk into depression. The time laps seemed like 10 min of staring into space, but ended up being a little over 2 hours. Everything that i had on my mind was thought about, but my main brain frame was stuck on him. Built up thoughts and perhaps happy times were brought into the deep blank stare. I would love to throw myself in safe mode and never say anything again. My body just feels weird, and i dont feel much like anything anymore. To have a really happy moment is almost a complete fade, and im stuck here. Too be here is fuzzy, and itchy at the same time. As i watched the candle flicker out in the corner of the tub, and the water around me was cold, and no longer warm, i felt that it was my duty too pull myself out. And i did. Drying myself off, i stopped and sat there and stared into the mirror. What a yucky yucky waste. I stumbled past the christmas tree that i really think i should have left in the box this year, and went right for the couch. I would have gone too bed, but i glanced at the clock and it was only 7:30. "I cannot be a total waste" i said to myself, and figured that mabye i could catch something on the tube. Channel flipping for the last hour has made me begin to grumble to myself. At this point i see the books that are lying on the table in front of me. Knowing that i should be reading, seeig how i am way behind on catching up. He has givin me many books, and i have just labled myself a total slacker. I really do want too read, but feel that my mind was not capable of doing so, in that moment. So the books stayed there and i gave them a glance every hour on the hour. So of course i flip some more, "why cant i stop thinking about him" flip some more michelle, flip some more. Out of the hours that i spent flipping, i finally ran across something that that made itll worth while, and it only lasted about 5 min. Imagine that. It was on MTV, of all places. Norah Jones, one video, one slight smile.....gone... The rain grown louder on this fucking tin can that i call home. And the clock on the wall now says 2:48. I whisper to myself, go to bed. I cant.. I might miss something, like he might call... How pathetic am i, to actually think that someone who rarly calls to begin with, would call me near 3 in the morning. Perhaps he might.. Perhaps he has been in bed for hours now, sleeping and dreaming. Perhaps i need to block him out, he has only caused pain. But love usually comes before that, thats why it is a constant struggle. Im strong, im struggling I went too bed, only to wake to more pounding rain and swollen eyes. Drag myself out of bed, to drag myself into work. Well its 11:13 now and no words have been shared between us. Not like i expected him to say anything, because thats how he is. But i have made no attemp either. What does that mean? We are stubborn that is what that means. Another waste of a day, another loss of good thoughts and happy memories. Not a smooth day, and i only have 6 1/2 hours to go. hoorah. As one of my co-workers mentions to me that i just dont look happy, and i respond to her im not, i see him for the first time today. He walks past my desk and heads out the fucking door. well, lunch is cancelled. "I had to breath myself through the rage within-even though the sun is shining, i cant avoid the lighting"

For the last couple of days, i have been having some problems with my blogger. It has not allowed me to post anything. But now it wants to work, go figure. Im all around excited, i am going to travel on an Amtrak train after christmas. Im going from here to Iowa, to see jason and to meet his family for the first time. Im siked!!! The train will have an observation car, that will be so awsome, i can take picture after picture. And im sure that it will be laptop ready. I will be traveling alone, i would rather have someone with me, seeing how i will be on there for about 9 Hours. Then after the train comes to an end, i will hop on a bus to take me the rest of the way. I love to travel, and this will be a experience for me. I cant wait! I would love to travel and see chris in Hawaii, but im sure my funds could not afford that trip. I would have to look into that. I could go and stay with him for a couple of days, and meet his wife and child. That would be really cool also. Pictures that i could take from there, would be incredible im sure. Well i might update later... Got to get back to work!!!

Complications of the family: This is a hard time of the year when everyone wants a peice of your time. Today my mom calls me at work, she wanted to know when i had planned on coming down for christmas. I told her when i was able too, turns out that she gets upset because it is not as long as she assumed. Now normally i eat my words, and agree and do what she wants me to do. This year i could not, i had to many things to do, and places to be. So she lables me for thinking that others are more importent than her. How do i get around this one? I have already apologized and said that i was sorry, and nothing is working, so here i sit and wait. Christmas is already gloomy for me this year, because funds are so low. I have tried so hard to try and please everyone, and like always,it just does not happen. I honestly want to stay at home, and if anyone wants to give me anything, then they can come to my house. Im so tired of stressing out and driving myself crazy to please everyone. And then once everything is running smoothly, i never get any credit for anything. On a lighter note: Today at work was not as crappy as it could have been, time inched along, but i have had worse days. So there-fore i cannot complain. I play pool tonight in my BCA league. I hope that we do really good tonight. I was going to have Jason, and a couple of others from work come and watch the tournament, but at the last min. they had to bail. Thats ok though, there will always be next week and the week after that. The weather is crappy here, cold cold cold. I wonder what the weather is like where Chris is? I bet he is letting the sun cascadeoff of him. He needs to know how lucky he really is!!!!!! heh Well im gonna get off of here... might update later tonight, and give the BCA score!!!!!

Today is sunday, and i have been so lazy. I have really done nothing. I moved my computer into the living room today so i can sit on the couch watch the tube. Dirty Dancing was on, that is my second fav. movie. And yes my first is pretty women. Two totally flick chics but they are so awsome. I just got through sending Chris an E-mail! His E-mail is back up again. I would love to see him agian. I have not seen him in quite some time. Today i was really planning on going to see my dad. He only lives about 2 hours from me. Jason was going to take me too see him. But things just didnt seem to work out. So i was sitting on the couch talking to jason on IM, and lisa shows up. She wanted me to go with her. So chucky, dennis, lisa and i went christmas shopping. That lasted about 4 hours, and now i am at her house. Im about to sit down and watch a movie with her. While she was finishing up a couple of things i just thought that i would hop on here and update the blog. Well i need to get off and watch this movie, untill tomorrow, its me heading out!

Yesterday i was having the worse day at work. Everyone was so bitchy, and they were getting on my nerves. Then after work it was planned that i go home with Jason because we were going to have our Christmas. So i did and i gave him his gifts, and he gave me mine. This was the best christmas! He ended up getting me books,dvd, and all the music that i asked him to burn he had done. BUT that was not the best part. HE built me a computer. How awsome is that. With me saving for another car, i was not able to save for a better computer. And he came through for me. I even cried, i could not handle it. It was so thoughtful and something that i really wanted. Today is my last day at work before my 9 days off, hoorah! I cant wait to pack up and get the hell away from my co-workers for awhile. The holidays are really almost over, and i cant wait for a better year next year. This year has been way to stressful for me. I cannot wait to get home and play on my computer and get all of my settings together. I also cannot wait to hop on the train and head out to IOWA. That will be so much fun. Im glad that chris said that he has done that before, so im not so nervous.

The weather is still nice here, a tad bit chillier than yesterday, but still considered nice. The sky is no longer partly cloudy, it has turned dark and stormy looking. When i went out for lunch it started to sprinkle, but no major storm yet. This morning was nice, my co-workers and I exchanged presents and we all had a good time. I also brought food for everybody this morning. Two more days and then i am off for a week! I have not heard from chris in awhile, i wonder how he is doing? I might throw him an e mail.....

Ah, Monday was a typical Monday. -TIME LAPSE- AH, Tuesday is a typical Tuesday. Today i have been so tired, i even stayed home last night and hung around the house. But im still dead tired. I feel that my eyes are gonna close on me, and i will have no control over them. Monday eyes on a Tuesday day. Work is dragging a tad, but it could be worse. Today is an awsome day when it comes to the weather. IT is about 70 today, and its in December. I love the weather, but that fact of that matter is, TORNADOS. Now i never really thought about tornados before i moved here, but i have seen two, and the last one jumped right over my house. So no, i do not play around when it comes to mother nature. My house is right in the path where they hit too. So i always have my eyes peeled. I bought a new lamp to put on my desk at work. Its the cutest little thing, i love it. Its purple and see through, and its too cute. See little things make me happy, lol. Well i really shoudl go, i am still at work, and as you can tell im not that busy right now. heh. NoTe To SeLf ********* Try and update your blog on a daily basis, stop being such a slacker!

Sunday, is it Sunday already? I dont understand where any of the time goes. At least this will be the last week of work before my 9 days off. Yesterday i hung out with Jason and we ran some errands, and then i went out with Lisa, Drew, and Ken to eat dinner and to watch a movie. Yes i am a fan of Emenim, Lisa and i love him, so we went and finally watched his movie *8 Mile*. I would have to say that it was a good movie, but i guess i expected it to be better than what it was. Today i got up and cleaned the house, Ken went to play golf, and Jason came over. We lounged around the house and then ran some more errands. After we got done he dropped me off, and the i went over to Lisa's. Since this week and the next will be hectikfor me, we decided that we would go ahead and do OUR gift exchange. So i went over there and we ate pizza and exchanged gifts. It was cool. I am glad that i have someone like Lisa. And now i am back home wondering where my weekend went! They say that the older you get the faster the time goes! I really am starting to believe it,lol. That reminds me, (gasp) my birthday is coming up. Im going to be 23! (February 18th) I went ahead and orderd my ticket for Amtrak. I really am thrilled that i am going. But it is gonna be sooo cold there. Im a TEXAS girl, and i dont adapt to 10 below zero very well! Damn Yanks, they like it cold,lol. Im know that i am already going to get teased because im from the south. And i have that so called "twang". But thats ok, i will put them in their place. *wink* If i do that for anyone it will be for Chris!

These last two weeks have been go go go, so no, i have not updated the site. I have had christmas after christmas everywhere this year. And im so wore out! Tonight about 1:30 in the morning i will be getting on the train and heading North. Like i really want it to get any colder, but thats the way that it is. well im gonna make this short, i still have plenty that i need to get done! Will update later!
Slow day, nothing much to post!

I forgot to mention the movie that J and i saw on the 7th. We saw "Gangs of New York". Its an absolute deep thinking movie and i loved it. Too me, if you are a deep thinker and would love to learn about sacrafice and demand, this is a movie for you! It was wondeful, although i hate to say that i cant go into detail about the movie. Its something that you have to see on your own, and make your own judgments. On a scale of 1-10 im gonna give it an 8. But, the feeling that it leaves you with is...............watch it! Daniel Day Lewis's voice sends chills down my spine, oooh sensual, and Good ole' DiCaprio's face and facial hair make me wanna..... you know! : Martin Scorsese's sweeping tale follows a young Irish-American immigrant, Amsterdam Vallon (Leonardo DiCaprio), who returns to the Five Points section of New York City in 1863. His father (Liam Neeson) was killed there 16 years earlier by William Cutting, a k a Bill the Butcher (Daniel Day-Lewis), a powerful anti-immigrant gang leader. Cameron Diaz co-stars as a pickpocket who was raised by Cutting in her youth and who is now in love with Amsterdam. Around them, the Civil War is in full swing, and the upcoming conscription is throwing the city into a panic, culminating in a city-wide riot. Release Date December 20, 2002 MPAA Rating R - intense strong violence, sexuality/nudity, and language Genre Drama, Crime, Historical Running Time 165 minutes Country U.S. Media Type Color Filming Location(s) Rome Another really good movie to watch out for is "The Hours". Its coming out on Jan. 17th! I will be in the movie theater! Jason introduced me to the book, and i finally got around to reading it. And now the movie is gonna kick ass! Some Info: Based on Michael Cunningham's Pulitzer Prize-winning novel, Hours draws on the life and work of Virginia Woolf (Nicole Kidman) to tell the story of three women: Woolf, who is portrayed in the throes of writing Mrs. Dalloway and contemplating suicide; Laura Brown (Julianne Moore), a young pregnant wife and mother in the suffocating confines of her tidy little life in Los Angeles in 1949; and Clarissa Vaughn (Meryl Streep), who is giving a party in the present in New York for her closest friend, Richard (Ed Harris), an award-winning writer dying of AIDS. NOT just a chick flick! ITs a must see baby........ LORD OF THE RINGS KICKED ASS! Lets not forget that one........Legolas is soooooo hot......kinky shelle likes Bow and Arrow!

"For me atmosphere and fantasy in music are really important,". "I think I'm an escapist really, even though I like dark things in music, and I think there are moments of darkness in this, but I like darkness when its fantastical and Scary Movie-ish rather than just bleak and gritty. I suppose that if music didn't give us this glimpse of something better I don't think we could stand to go on with our lives, we'd just give up. I think in any type of music, not just mine, the best of it gives you a glimpse of paradise, or a better world or some hope. Its like you can achieve some sort of... I don't know if I'd say perfection but something free from all the shit of your life, in music." Frou Frou: a sound that drives you happy. It has turned cold here, and the sky is really putting off the cloudy "its winter time" theme. It is sort of late and i should be in bed, but im not! Next Thursday i plan on going to the Gym with my sister. I wanted to go tonight. But i was having some problems with my computer and had Jason come over and fixedt. I cant believe that its only Monday. After you take off for so long i guess it seems like the days that you do work are just extra long. I didnt play pool tonight, and i am gonna hang out with J tomorrow night. But i have to play pool on weds. I wanna do something, but not sure as to what i really wanna do. I want to like take a trip or something. Even though i got back from Iowa not too long ago, i yet again crave another trip. I like being places where i have to discover things i guess. I like being alone ina sense of people that you normally see are miles away. Thats groove. I think that J and i might go see a movie tomorrow. Although there are alot of movies that i wanna see. Im not sure what we are gonna watch yet. I guess we will find out when we walk into it. Thats me, i hardly ever plan, because when i do, things dont turn out like you planned! lol Now my eyes are getting droopy, i wonder what that means? TIRED I AM. Even though i hate AOL, i actually went browsing in the settings and found this awsome LORD OF THE RINGS background of "LEGOLAS". Oh man he is so HOT! I loved that movie and recently watched the Twin Towers. It was good, not as good as the first, but real good. Just like Star Wars, im hooked! Well i need to get off here and hit the pillow, Love ya world, Michelles back in action thanks to Jason! SHELLE

Last night was quite the night, I get off work to go tan. I walk in there and the lady that owns the place was actually working. I ask her what products to use and what might be healthy for my skin. And she was quite upset that the other ladys let me in there for 30 min. And therefore allowed me to burn. So she ended up throwing me in there for about 15 min this time and didnt mark me down for having a visit. I thought that was really cool, that makes me think that she values her customers. I told her that i was not there to get a free visit or to get anyone in trouble, i just wanted to make sure that i was not doing harm to my skin. So i ended up tanning and i still feel great, no burns, no peeling. After i was done tanning i headed out for the gym. The gym was rather crowded, and i was surprised seeing how it was about 8:00. So i go in there and sweat sweat, and get in the sauna for a bit. I actually used more weights than i do normally, and when i woke up this morning the muscle that goes up my leg and behind my knee is killing me. I must have pulled it somehow, and now i cant bend my knee all the way, not including this wonderful crick that i have in my neck as well. (im turning 23 im falling apart). So im no longer burned, but my body parts are giving out. So my work day is full of limping around like a gimp, but it makes you think about little things that you take for granted! Then when i get home from the gym, Jason instant messages me and says that his dad called him and told him that his Grandmother will be passing soon. He was pretty upset, so i hopped back in the car and went over there to make sure that he was alright.i Think that he might be going to Iowa this weekend. Last weekend i cancelled card night and this weekend he will be cancelling card night. Perhaps next weekend. Next weekend i plan on introducing SKIP-BO to Stacey,Linda,Eric, and Jason. Im sure that they will like it. When we all have card night we usually play a game called PHASE-10. Its really fun, and we all laugh and pick on each other and have a good time. Tonight i plan on going back to the tanning bed and mabye hitting it for about 20 min or so. I will not be able to work out for i am crippled. So i think that i will be tanning, then going home and cooking some dinner tonight. Perhaps i will cook some Chicken Spagetti. Not really good for my diet, but everyone needs a treat some time. seeing how i have not had a soda since New Years Eve. Not even a diet soda! I have been drinking water, and Crystal Light has become my next best friend. Even though Crystal Light is a tad bit expensive, the Kroger brand is just as good. So that is the way that i go. YES Chris called me last night and i was not able to talk with him very long because i was headed out towards that tanning place. But i love to hear from him, and he will call me back on Saterday. I finally got my stove fixed last night as well. We were having a mice problem for awhile there, and finally were able to get rid of them. Well one day i went to heat up the stove to boil some water, and this awful smell started to come out of the burners and oven. I about threw up it was sooooooo bad. I had to shut everything off and air out my house. I scrubbed and cleaned my stove from top to bottom, turned it back on and there was no diffrence. What had happened was that a mouse got in the padding around the oven that keeps everything else from getting hot. When he got in there he was starting to make my stove his home. Just like hamsters chew things to make a bed, this is what he was doing. Peeing and pooping in there, GOD, you could imagine the smell of that alone! Then Ken takes off the top and there he is. There is a mouse that is dead and cooked to the side of the stove. I WANTED TO THROW UP! But that was what it was. Now the problem is all taken care of, and i am a happy cooker once more.Its amazing, the little things that seem to make me happy at certain times, ha...... Well i really need to get some stuff done, so im gonna stop rambling! See ya..

Today is Sunday, normally i would be in s sigh because work is tomorrow, but tomorrow is MLK and Robert E. Lee day. One of the perks of working with the state is that we seem to get a day off when someone sneezes. Ha, im not complaining! So i know that i have another day of being lazy and getting enough free time to go to the gym. I have become a gym junkie. Not so much that that is a bad thing, but can get kinda costly. I wish that Chris would hurry up and open is gym, mabye at least he would give me a discount, and i could higher him as my personel trainer. Today is such a wonderful day, well, weather wise. Its sunny and the wind is blowing a tad bit hard, but it brings a cool breeze. When i went walking today i went to the top of the hill close to the house. You can see for quite a ways from there. And i just stood there, the breeze blowing my hair back and fourth on my back,and me lost in teh scene that was before me. All the tall grass blowing one way then to the other. The trees seeming as if they were gonna bend and possibly break, and the sun to give no shadow. Another moment in my life where i could say im happy to be there at that moment in time. Wanting to stay there forever, knowing that as soon as i take a step away that moment is over. I will always save them in my mind, but the graphic graphic picture is gone. Although i have done many things today, it just seems like the day is flying by. I went to the motorcross show last night. It was really neat, i had a good time. Although when i arrived and looked around, it was like every Redneck in Arkanasas and the surrounding cities was there pushed all together in that arena. I was just putting points left and right on my list of *why to be ashamed of Arkansas*. Not only were the adults bad enough, but that things that they do to there children. All the boys had the buzz cut with the long hair towards the back. And all the girls just seemed to look dirty. I honestly to not know how that the two sexs even come together to reproduce. Yes, Yes, i understand that there is at least a handful of these kinds in every city and state. But to be surrounded by many at once makes you wanna take a step back and grab for the sanitizer. Please dont think that i put myself up as being the best chick to walk these grounds. But when all the men look at ya and lick there lips as like they would like to hunt ya down, Fer good eatin, humm, nuff said. Still waiting on my chance to take another trip. I need to get away and see things. Take pictures, and be engulfed in romance. Im actually starting to read more and do some things that i have been putting off for quite some time now. Finished one of Jasons books and returned it to him. And about an hour ago, i just came in from sitting in the sun and listening to music, and drawing. I used to draw all the time back when i lived at home. Just seems that i grew up and other activites came along with that. But i want to recapture what i had at one time. A time when i never stressed out and everything was smoother. Even though i have more freedom now, some things i would like to have back. Even though you grow up and sacrifice certain things to have other things, sometimes you do want what you had back. And really alot of times you dont even notice what you are giving up. I used to stay in my room and draw, mom would come get me for dinner. I would eat and then go right back to my desk. And to be honest, i cant remember when i stopped doing that. When i actually gave up what had intrest me for the longest time. Its true, you just look back and say, who, what, when, where, and why. And some of your answers might surprise even yourself. I have so many things that take up my time, but at the same time i try to bring back everything that i used to do, and i end up getting lost. And then i end up getting nothing done! Humm, what should a girl do...... Have you ever stopped and thought about how much people take up your time? Think about it...Think about all the people that you deal with every day, then add about 10-20 more people that are extras that you deal with every day. And then ask your self, how much time do you really have for yourself? I need to clean my house a little, so im outta here!
urlLink Pics of me!

With Heavy thought I have pondered on where I would love to go, if given the chance.. And here is what I have come up with: Seattle, Washington: Although it is definitely quite the drive from here, I have a passion for a visit! People in Seattle buy more books per capita than almost anywhere else in the United States. It is also a center of writers of all genres. It has a proliferation of bookstores, particularly specialized or quirky independent shops; coffeehouses and taverns featuring poets and open-mike readings; strong public library systems; regular author and book signings; and - perhaps most noticeably - people reading books in the most unlikely public settings." The numerous universities and research centers located there provide training to a public eager to expand its learning and offer a tremendous research resource for the business community.Their region is second in the US in the percentage of adults with college degrees. Nearly one third have completed a bachelor's degree, and ten percent have a graduate degree. One place that I would have to be absolutely sure to visit would be the Pike Place Market (downtown Seattle). This shopping mall has over 600 stores inside. It has everything from Bistro’s to art galleries to antiques. This would have to be a day long event for shelle. Then after that day long event, my nightlife would begin. And my club of choice would be: Club Medusa… The Greek mythology theme is kept to a stylish minimum; the bulk of the ambience comes from the expensive lighting, the house and trance music. But of course before I hit the club, I would love to stop at Barca for a drink, and well, to just enjoy the view. From its gargantuan mosque-style wooden doors and cobalt blue exterior to its hand-tiled curving mosaic bar and blown-glass light fixtures, Barca oozes Euro-Mediterranean cool.Seattle has so much to offer, that i am sure one week there would not do. I would love to walk along the waterfront, go too so many coffee shops. They have live band concerts at random. What more could I ask for? This is one of my many places to roam.

Just went outside for a smoke break, and the sky is dark, the wind is picking up and it looks like heavy rain. Seeing how is usually does, i will expect it to hit about 5:00 when its time to go. I love rain and storms, but the thing is, its warm. And when its warm and storms roll in, you guessed it, Tornados arise. And the spot where my house sits, about a couple of years ago, one came through and took out all the houses including the one that was in my spot. And before that one came through and followed the same path, and took out my moms house. Last year we had one come through and hop right over my house. I felt the wind and heard the thunder noise everyone speaks of. It was not fun and very scary. Its scary to think that every thing you own, and everything in your past can be taken away from one in seconds. Yikes! SO needless to say in all this babble, when storms roll in and its warm, my eyes are on the sky!

Last night was a rather emotional night, for reasons that i feel i should keep inside. I went to bed early, my eyes were puffy and they burned. I was hoping that i was not going to get too much sleep agian, and feel like crap. So i took a shower and enjoyed the sound of running water. I had the shower on and sat in the bottom of the tub, and closed my eyes. The steam was pouring out over the top of the shower curtain, and i was in full relaxation mode.The only reason that i was tempted to get out was because where the water had beat on me, it was starting to leave red marks. Just sitting there and thinking about everything that has happend or will happen. When i got out of the shower, i was in the mood to read. Knowing ahead of time that reading will make me tired, i did so anyways. Good ole Robert Frost to the rescue.....Ah , sweet nectar......ar ar ar Today for lunch, J , Eric and I went to have lunch and then to pick J's car up from the shop. About 75 bucks, cheap and wonderful. And we are so happy to have the car back. SABINA is back in action.Whooo-hoooo Im hanging out with J-tonight, not sure what we are doing, but i really dont care. His company is wonderful and i enjoy it very much so. The weather today is cloudy and drizzle here and there. It sounds icky, but to me its rather nice. A comfortable feeling, ya know. To watch the rain and clouds. And to smell that fresh rain smell....very nice. Tis it is, reading weather. Chatted on and off with Thomas today, he is busy, but not as busy as he has been. Feels good to talk to him, like he understands things that i deal with. He seems a little strange latley, but perhaps thats just me. Chris Finally sent me an e mail back. Poor guy, being in the army right now is tuff, and i want him home ASAP!!!!! Chris is a grown man (25) but i know that certain things can take over your mind, and im afraid that might be happening to him in the Army! Keep your head up, and know that i watch over you Christopher! I need to go visit my dad here soon, its been awhile and i miss him. A visit is overdue! (talk to J) Communication with the rest of my family needs to get better as well. I am a independent person and i can go weeks or months without saying a simple hello, and thats bad for me. But you also have to understand what i have been through with them. Ah well, not getting into that one....yeeesshhh I would like to find or get in touch with a guy that i used to date, he is awesome. His name is Justin, Thomas reminds me of him, with his laugh. And now i feel that i have to find him again. The story of Justin is, he was in a Private school, and i was in a public school. But i would always meet him and sit with him. He was incredible, very smart, he was way ahead of me at that time.We would always just talk and walk together. Never kissed or anything like that, We would hold hands, but it was diffrent, he was diffrent. He was wonderful, and i have lost him. I would want to know what he was doing and what he has become. Im sure that he is married with kids, because he was a keeper. I was too young and didnt know what i had at the time. He even dedicated a song to me on the radio one time. Funny story about that.....My mom and I were taking a movie back to Block Buster, and we were driving in the car, we were quiet, and then here is Justin, on the radio dedicating this song to me. Mom and I just looked at each other and we smiled. Nothing as said, it stayed in silence, but was a very Groovy time in my life. And to make is cheesy, the song was a Celine Dion Song. But that was when she FIRST came out and her songs were very powerful with words of love. It was nice....I will never forget that. Im wondering on how i would find him.I dont remember his last name, and he has moved since then. I remember his sisters name was Sarah. Geez, is that bad or what. How would i find him?????/ Crap, mabye i have lost him forever........

Bah Today i was missing J soooo much, he was at his Photoshop class. Im glad that he is getting to learn how to do it. Some of the things that he is learning, he can teach me. So that is a bonus! The car is still in the shop, they will have to keep it over night. But it will be ready tomorrow, and the better news is, is that it will not cost as much as one can imagine. Her will be back tomorrow, and for that i am SO happy! Next week we are going to take her to get all her stuff checked out and make sure that she is A-ok for the trip to Dallas! Speaking of Dallas,,,,,, yes ,,,, we are one day closer to hitting the road, and seeing Thomas, and Rick. Have to have a day of relaxation tonight. Just catch up on reading and cleaning. Things like that seem to pile up like mad. This week at work has been nice. Everyone is gone and its been quiet, and im able to get things done. Ah, but next week will be right back to being the same....gerrrr AT least i got a little break, no? Ok, i guess shelle will stop blah blah blahing and get off here.....till next time, i bid you adue..... J likes her voice....(note to self) ....Must learn to talk like good ole Ani! ................................Hers silly...........................................

Yesterday was a day of a day, a dooooozy! When i arrived at work, and saw J, he looked so tired.Poor thing, the trip must be catching up with him. J and I are diffrent in several ways, and this is one of them. Its wierd, i can be dead tired and still force and smile and be in a cheerful mood. But when he is tired, he is quiet and it seems like his daily routine is in slow-mo. Dont get me wrong, i have days like that also, but they are not as frequent as his. Anyways, He didnt feel very good and was really tired. Well he told me that he was going to stay home after lunch, and take a half a day off. So we left to go to lunch, and we were heading towards his house when we noticed that his car started to slip. That was the last thing that J needed at this point. So for lunch we went to Auto Zone and put some Trans. fluid in . Dropped J off at home and i drove the car back to work. She was acting just fine, was no longer slipping and shifting well. Another 5 hours at work..... After work, i got back into the car and headed off to J's house. Pulled up and told him that i really wanted to see if there was a leak. SO we pulled it up in the yard,and he started to look underneath it. He still had on his nice clothes and now they were all muddy, from the rain the night before. He was trying to see if there was a leak, and he took the tire off the car.His nice shirt rubbed across the brakes from the exposed wheel, and now he had grease on his shirt. He took off his glasses and threw them on the ground, as he was getting under the car again. He got up and walked around to move the steering wheel for the tires to move. Walked back over and stepped on his glasses, bend one side all to hell. And at this time, he was about to have a nervous break down. He couldnt take it any longer, when it rained it poured for sure today. One of those times that everything you want to do will be harder than normal, or just not work at all. He said "fuck it" and went inside, left everything as it was. The tire was not on the car and there were tools laid out everywhere. I sat there for a sec. then went inside. I hopped on the phone to see if my buddy paul could get him in today to look at the car. Turns out that he left to go out of town. As i was talking, J walked by and paths kinda crossed, he said "get the Fuck out of my way". I was in shock that he said it, but let him be, and went outside to finish my conversation. So i hopped on the phone with Jiffy Lube, (5:45) i told him that the car was brought in last Friday, and now there is a leak.That i dont need them to do anything, i just need them to look at it and tell me if there is a leak. So, She says :"we close at 6, if you can get here, we will look at it". I hang up, tell J that i have 15 min to get to Jiffy lube.He says that he does not want to go. So i said, fine i will go. Go put the tire back on the car. He did, slow as ever. I hopped in the car and fought 5-6 O' clock traffic. Pulled into Jiffy Lube at 6:03, they looked at it and said that we did have a leak. It was leaking from the seal, on the Drive-shaft, and leaking down the line. I said ok, thats all i needed to know. So i drove off and headed back to Js house. When i got there J said that he was sorry for how he was acting, and i hugged him. I told him that I know how he feels and that its ok. That i know how everything can pile up on you at once and make you nearly go blind, i said that i was here for him, no matter what. And that everything will work it self out in due time, and that it will be ok......

30 Min after i got home from work, the rain came, and it came with avengence. The rain pounded the roof, and the wind bended trees like strings, and shelle backed away from the door. The lights went out and came back on, 10 min. later and it was gone. It is usually rare to have a storm that early in the evening, but then again, alot more things are getting wierd to me. Bah... J called and said that our bud Amy called and wanted to meet us for dinner. I was siked because we have not seen her in months. She says that she still enjoys Kentucky, and that the weather is not as bad as here. Her trip down here was tough on her, but she made it. So we headed out to eat dinner, and then all of us (5) went to Barnes and Noble. I totally went over my limit on money and books. I bought a Robert Frost Poems book, on sale mind you! I love his work, and couldnt pass it up. Along with that i bought three Photo Magazines. It wouldnt be so bad if they werent like 8 bucks a pop. But the pictures and knowlege that they hold is soooo hard to pass up. I want to be a good photographer so bad, it hurts. But i want to be good at alot of things. This seems to come a little but more natural to me, and that is quite tasty. Jason seems to think that im creative, and i take good pictures, so he gives me hope that mabye i can go somewhere with this. (sigh) will i ever be good at anything? I stayed up so late last night, till about 2:30 or so. Just couldnt go to sleep and was playing with my camera. I should know better than to pick the camera up or get into Photoshop as the night turns into dark, because i will not get off early enough to get good sleep. And trust me, i think i need to catch up on some beauty sleep! gerrrrr........ To do list..... 1. Get Thomas's package ready 2. Work out....eeshh 3. Plan for my Dallas trip 4. Hang out with Amy 5.Get my life sorted out Dont forget John Mayer and the Counting Crows are coming in Concert!

Tuesday today, feels like a Monday..... Returning to work was eh.... Although i was really busy this morning, the good thing is that it made time fly. I have three hours of work to go, Whoo-hoo! Now i am planning on going to Dallas for Memorial Day.. Here are the plans so far.... Thursday: Work, leave after work to go to Arkedelphia to see Thomas! Then head out after that to meet up wiith Rick and Laura in Hope. Spend the night... Friday: Get up and head off to Dallas... Mon: Head back home, perhaps see thomas on the way back through! Anyways those are the plans, lets see if they stay stable!......

ok, ok, serious shame on me, for just now getting back to my posting life. Since you last knew anything about me, i have met another badass bud. Thomas rocks, plain and simple, for he is so funny and good for kind words. We have talked on and off on Instant Messenger, for awhile. Then it was time to meet him, and he was better than what i expected. J and I went down there to meet him, and he was so funny. He is full of creative ideas and loves to babble. And is is always paranoid about his babble, but in reality its great to listen to. Did i mention that he is badass at what he does, he takes it so lightly when i tell him that, but he is. He brought a package for me, i would have to say that i was VERY impressed. I always wait to see how things like that go, because how much time someone puts into something counts in my book. You could tell that he put some time into this, and it was awesome! The pictures alone that were made for me, took time alone. And speaking of that, they are heavenly wonderful. When i first saw them, my mouth dropped, he thought i was putting on a show im sure. But the seriousness that i had was unreal. The colors were blended with such force, very nice.The texture that it had was awesome, i couldnt keep my eyes off of it. There were 2 shirts that were also included, from a quote that came out of my mouth! Gasp@! makes me sound like a little devil......"one night the cat will own you"........Well, now i have two shirts to wear, when i feel like being openly naughty. Its cool. Also included was a wonderful packet full of doodles that he has done. They are very good, i would love to see what is not a doodle. I love nerds, and there are some packets that he gave me! THOSE ROCK. (note to self: dammit shelle, get his package out) I just got back form a trip, J and I went to Iowa! I had a blast, but that was to be expected! The trip down there was long but cool. My visit with his family was closer this time, and i loved it. We did a whole lot of driving on this trip, about 3000 miles total! The weather was unexpected, it grew cold and the wind was outrageous, but i seemed to manage.We went to Visit his grandmothers house that recently passed. It was hard on Jason when she passed, but going through the memories of the house got the best of him again. All i could do was hold him, for the tears he was trying to fight back were winning. Knowing in my ownmind that it will someday happen to me with my parents, its hard to think about. I would not know what to do without my family, but i know that someday i will have to deal with that. I look around and see people whos parents have passed, and often wonder how they are dealing with it. In my mind i see myself locked in a room, and never wanting to come out. But knowing that life needs to go on. Anyways the trip was good, its awesome to get away from things for awhile, and for me its well needed.Oh yeah, J also took me by his college campus, in Aimes. The campus was full of beauty! Old buildings and landscapes, i was sooo impressed! The kind of place that pictures would do it no justice. I was able to get a picture of one of the buildings. This building was incredible.Seeing J point out everything was cool. He was so excited, and his eyes grew so big as he went through his memories of being a student again. The trip back brought some wonderful pictures.....J was taking pictures of the sky as the sun started to leave us. I was driving about 80, had the windows down, and groove music playing. And an occasional smoke, as J took pictures of the sunset. He ended up with some incredible pictures that i will have to show Thomas. It reminded me of him, because of all the colors working together so well, looked like a canvas. He will dig them i hope....

Today is (so far) about 10 times better than the two or three previous days. Besides my tooth looking crazy and all. It bothers me, but im trying to get over it. Gerrrrr..... Just had lunch so that means that im getting closer to time to go, im happy about that. Hopefully i can leave about an hour early, and J and i will see thomas about 5:30 or so....Awesome..I have everything together, and ready to go. We will stop by my house on the way out, so i can see if UPS deliverd my package. hehe, J will be surprised! I hope! See ya .........

Will my life ever get back on track? Not only was my dentist appt last week not a good one, but today about an hour ago, my tooth in the front of my mouth chipped! Fuck, no money, more problems. Trying my hardest to stay on top of the smile, instead of falling down beneath one. Its getting harder, no matter what i seem to do to take my mind off it. Im scared to eat, scared that i might break something else. Hey, perhaps this will be a way that i can also lose weight! hell, i dunno. Today i went to Amber's Dad's funeral, so i guess it wasnt a good day from the start. But i had to be there for her, as i hope that she would be there for me.It was a sad day of teary eyes, looks that are not natural, and clouds that filled the sky, temping to rain. The sad letters that were read during the service from Amber and friends about her dad, thats enough for a cryfest alone. The look around the room full of people that are still in shock, and need to be held. Quite disturbing.........Her brother is a preacher, and he said that his dad asked him to preach at his funeral. So he did for a bit, and in the middle of it, he asked us to bow our heads to pray. Then he told us that everyone in this room will die, there is no doubt about it. Then he says : "If god was to come for you tomorrow, would you be ready?" "If you are not sure, just raise your hands so we can pray for you". I wanted to raise my hand, it was wierd, im not a bad person, but i dont go to church, and i just felt that i may not be accepted i guess. I dont know what to really think about it all. I didnt raise my hand. The other girls and i got into the car and followed them over to the grave site. We were talking on the way over there, and they started talking about it, well i made the mistake of saying that i sorda wanted to raise my hand. We pull up and go to the site, after the service there was over, one of my co-workers went to her brother (preacher) and told him that i was really wantingto raise my hand. So him and his sidekick came over and introduced himself, and they both took my hand and started praying about me. If that is not a shocker alone, i had closed my eyes, and was just in a uncomfortable state. Just because i was put on the spot and i felt bad about not going to church and this and that. After the 30 min prayer, it seemed like, he asked me "did you ask god for forgiveness?" I replyed truthfully, and said " i didnt think i had too, i think that he knows what i want". I was wanting to hit myself in the head!!!! It was the truth, but was hoping that he knew what i meant, instead of taking it the wrong way. And, whew, i think he knew what i was trying to say. I was kinda mad at my co-worker, i cant be mad for what she was trying to do, by all means. But i dont think its her place to force me into a situation like that. I feel, that people will know when its time. True that some need a little push, but i was just really uncomfortable. I should be in a good mood though, i leave for Dallas tomorrow, and get to see Thomas. Perhaps he can cheer me up. Jason has been really helpful, when my tooth chipped tonight, i just had so much on my mind, and this seemed to be the last straw.I cried for about 10 min. then bucked it up. I just feel that what little i have of looks, are just going to shit. And being broke sucks ass! ah shucks....... nothing new........nothing new..........Be a man about it shelle! 1Funerals 2pets dying 3.teeth falling out and chipping 4no money, completley broke 5no emotional support It has to get better right? please, please say yes...............................................................................................................

Tuesday Night was a relax night..... Got off work and went over to Js, watched some Tv, went to eat and then went to Barnes. I hate going into Barnes when im broke (oh wait, thats all the time) because i cant get anything, and there is so much that i want. I just had so many ideas flow to me at once, and i tried to get them all started. Needless to say that when i opened my eyes this morning, i hated the light. But drug myself out of bed, had some coffee, and im set for the day. Today i will go to Amber's Dads funeral. It is held over in Fordyce, about an hour from here. I will ride with a couple of co-workers, and im sure the ride will be silent. I dont want to go, because i will hate to see her cry, hate hate hate it. But she needs to know that i am there for her. And i will be. Jason took off to Petit Jean today to get some work done on there computers. We shall meet up after work once more. Thomas said that he was going to in town today, and that rocks. He said that he was going to be watching movies. I hope that he sees FRIDA! For gods sake, he paints for a living! And i thought it was MOST excellent, so i can imagine what he will think, if he would just go!!! BTW- His art is off the wall wonderful....It is a must see......I wish i had talent like he does,damn. Ah well, at least i can get lost in his work, and enjoy the serine colors of his wonderful mind. Radio Paradise is playing Michelle Shocked (come along way) oh man that song rocks! J actually introduced me to her and that song as well, then i heard it on Radio Paradise, and that is super sweet! What i wouldnt give to be able to hear Radio Paradise in the car, SWEEEEET, but alas the money to do it with is and never was here. My trip to Dallas starts tomorrow after work, im siked! Orderd somthing for J off Amazon, we should recieve it before we hit the road, he will be surprised. As if Mondays were not bad enough...... I am having so many problems with my Bank. But i guess you could say that it was my fault opening with a local bank. Its Saterday night.....But lets rewind for a time..... Friday night after work I went to hang out with J, we were sitting on his porch and he asked me what i wanted to do. I answered, well i think we should just stay here and chill, save some money and just enjoy the company. As soon as i was done saying those words, the Tornado sirens went off. We looked at each other and went inside and turned on the tube. It was nasty and it was the first of it. There were about 3 heavy storms coming through. And the sky turned dark in a blink of an eye. The wind was outrageous! We watched for a bit, and started to pick out where we were gonna duck in the house. Then the T.V. said that two tornados had touched down CLOSE to my house. I freaked out, i knew that Mika was there alone, and didnt know what to do. I started to think about how little i played with her the night before. And how much i loved her. Its funny how wierd things start to go on in your mind, when you are put into a panic situation. I started to cry, and J was very helpful. J held me and told me that it would be ok, and that we would go get her. I knew that it would not be safe to do so right away, i had to think of us. So we waited a bit and watched it on the tube, so we knew when it would be halfway safe. Then it hit me, what about Thomas? Is Thomas alright, was he in the path? I started to freak out about that. J and i went outside in the middle of his street and watched the skies. We took some pictures and went back in. We were starting to lose light, i knew that if we went we needed to go now. So i said, ok, lets go get her. We started on our way, and about 10 min later, we hit HUGE rain and strong winds. I told him to turn around, this was crazy! He just said .....no. And we continued. He told me to watch the skies and i did. All i could think about was the fact that we were driving right in the way, where they were. We seriously went right in the middle of the two storms. We got to the house, i grabbed Mika and we took off. We fought the rain all the way back. He was hitting light after light, so he turned off a road and tried to take a short cut. He turned into this parking lot to turn around, and i yelled "ITS ALL WATER". He hit it and the water was at the top of the hood. He threw it in reverse, and i looked to the side, there was a bus. A bus was coming our way, he backed out and spun around. I would have to say that he did it very well actually. Like we were in a Fast and Furious movie. We finally made it back to his house, and Mika was releaved, along with her momma. The sirens were still going off when we arrived back, it was about 8:30 or so. The rest of the night we watched Tv, and i told him to go to sleep. He was sao tired and i knew that that was where he needed to be. So Mika and I went home..... Saterday morning, i woke up late, and Lisa came over and wanted me to to Wal-mart with her. I went and played around with her a bit. Then we ended up going out to eat and watched a movie. (Daddy Day Care) It was cute and funny. But not one of my favs. Needless to say, that i watched it for her, hehe. Have to go to the dentist, i am having problems with my back teeth!!! Shit, the last thing i need, and cant afford! Im hoping that i will be able to catch a money break soon. I didnt get to see J today, but talked to him a couple of times....... Thomas sent me an E mail, its good to hear from him! Im gonna go moke, im getting off here!

Went to the dentist, whew, not a good thing. I have to get some work done, i have 2 cavities, and a tooth chipped. But i promise i dont look like im a true Arkansan! ha. It will cost me over 2000 dollers to get all the work done that i need, and that is with insurance helping! I have shitty dental insurance. They dropped the original plan, and im stuck with this. What can you do? gerrrrrr.... How do they expect me to go in and pay 300-400 dollers a visit? Out of your mind is more like it...enough depressing info..moving along... Things that are on the mind... Mark Rothko Altoids- Tangerine Sours Ready-made and Nest Magazine Gardening When is my next trip? Money, but this will be on every list i seem to make!

Where could Shelle start......... Thursday.... J and I left and headed out about 4:15, and went to my house. I was going to surprise him with a package, but UPS had not been there, so we left and hit the road. We hit the road, and our first stop was Arkadelphia, for Thomas. We met up with him at Mcdonalds, and it was awesome because he brought his drawings in a book. So we ate we looked at his drawings, and that was fun. Thomas was like, "lets play Rock, Paper, Scissors". Ha, i beat him right off the bat. (Shelle gets up and does Rocky dance). Than we played again and he won, shushhhh, shelle let him win. hehe Then i busted out some Tic Tac Toe, yes yes, shelle wins that too. We chatted for awhile, and headed off to his house. Wow, his stuff was awesome, all his paintings. He showed us his drawings and stuff that his friends had givin him. Lets say that Thomas has an awesome colllection of things. And has many talented friends as well. Thomas also made us brownies, now that was sooo cool. He made us brownies with little M&Ms in them. He rememberd what her liked....So sweet. Finally met Betty and his Mom, that was groovy too. Left his house and head off towards Ricks place. We arrived kinda late, but chatted with them a tad and then went to bed. Got up the next morning and rick had to leave to go to work, J and I had lunch with Laura and the Kids. It was so nice, we sat out on their front porch and the rising sun to our backs. It was still cool outside and laura made breakfast. We sat and ate breakfast with the boys, and laura. Played around a bit, then took turns in the showers, and hit the road. Ah, we were on the way to Dallas, and excited we were....We arrived and Mom wanted to take us out for lunch. We ate, and then hit up some museums. The Carter, The Kimbell, and the new Modern Museum. Wow, what a treat it was! I saw TWO MARK ROTHKOS, in the new Modern Mus. I was in awwww... All i could do was sit there and stare, and stare, and stare. I could not grasp the fact that i was looking at originals, in person....It was amazing, and that alone was worth the trip! After that we took mom home, and i took Jason on a little drive around town. I think that he likes the place alot. And that made me feel good, that he was having a good time. The next day we went back to the Carter and went to the IMAX Omni, watched a show called "speed" and had a great time there. We did some more driving around, and went to a bar with my brother, to see a blues band. It was neat, and had a good time. Kicked back a few, and realaxed. Went to Dallas and drove around, hit Deep Ellum up and walked around a little. Drove around and took pictures of some of the buildings, and great stories were told. Sunday night we stayed at the house, and played a trivia game with Mom. It was trivia on 50 and 60s music. Instead of playing the game, I read the questions and Jason went against my Mom. It was FUN, and we all had a good time. Monday morning we got up and went to breakfast with Mom, then headed out to the 303 mall. Jason racked up some clothes and i ended up getting some things as well. We said our good-byes to Mom in the parking lot then we hit the road back. The drive back was nice because it was sooo nice outside. It was not hot or cold, just perfect. We hit a Adult Video store on the way back, and stopped for a few mins. Hit the road again, and headed towards Ricks house. They were celebrating his birthday, so we stayed for a while. Played with the kids, told them about our trip, and then hit the road once more. This time we were heading towards Thomas's house. Surprised Thomas, i could tell when he opened the door, but it was all good. I told him that we were hungry, and wanted to know if he would join us. So we all went to the Pizza hut in town, sat out on the patio, grubbed and ate. Sweet Sweet little moments. AFter awhile, yes yes, we hit the road again Got home, hehe, naughty......sleep (fence...moms yard) Sorry its not more detailed, but my mind is mushy......Dentist appt. today!

Having a very hard time right now.... I was having a problem with my computer for the last 2 days. I had been without it because there was something going on, and it wouldnt turn on. I had made myself completly frustrated trying to figure it out. working on it for hours, and getting no where. I knew a few things that it might be, but had no idea how to fix it. I called J when i first found out about my computer problem, and he gave me a few vague things off the top of his head. I understood the fact that he wasnt there and that there was not much that he could do. So i let it go thinking that he might have some ideas for me tomorrow. The next day (today) i mentioned my computer still not working even though i worked on it a couple of hours after i got off the phone with him last night. He said nothing...i blew it off.... I go home and mess around with it for about 2 hours, then give him a call. trying to tell him, that i noticed this and that, and i was really frustrated and getting nowhere. All he wanted to do was criticize the shit that goes on around me, and tell me how pathetic things are. So i said: " You want to know what i think is pathetic, you for not trying to help me, your sitting over there, and your not even making the attempt" And he said nothing, so i said bye and hung up. I hardly ever get attitude with J, but i was pissed at the fact that he does this shit for a living, and if im supposed to mean something to him, then help me! And he sure hasnt gone out of his way to help me. After about 2 hours he shows up, i was shocked, and he shows up with a power supply. I know that he does not have the money to be doing thses things, and i totally appreciated it. And i wanted to hug his neck. He tried to fix my computer and couldnt. I plugged it back up after he took the new part out, and BOOM it worked. I dont know why and i dont know how, all i know is that it worked. And that was a relief. As i was pushing it back, i said "I hate this thing" then across from the room, i hear, "ok, well, see ya later" he was leaving, that pissed me off. Granted i was mad about my computer, but i was mad that he acted the way that he did to begin with. And i was not over it yet. And then he just added to it. He walked out, i headed towards the door, i said: " so just like that, you are going to leave?" His response was " Well your cranky" So i said ok, i was not going to beg him to stay. When he pulled away in his car, i watched him through the window, thinking about what an asshole he is, but there was a feeling of helplessness that he left me. Just knowing that he was no longer in the room, and no where close hurt me. I wanted to chase after the car, and tell him that i already miss him, and i dont want him to leave. But i didnt, i hit the door, said "asshole" and sat down. Then i thought that i should call him, and leave a message on his machine about every feeling that i thought about him. But i knew that that was immature and i was pissed, adn didnt want to say something that i didnt mean. So here i am, blogging about it...Im such a fucking loser..sigh I wanted to tell him that i appreciated what he did, and that he was very sweet to do that. But it was the fact that he didnt make a move, and wouldnt have thought about it until i told him that he was pathetic. I feel that he judges me way too much, and puts me in a spot that he is inferior to me. I dont know what to think anymore. Yeah, i am a women and my emotions are wierd at times. But i know that im not wrong about this, at least i dont think so? I wish that he would have turned around, said that he was sorry, i would have said that i was sorry! mabye had said, are you hungry, lets go grab something to eat and talk! Why is that soooooooooo hard to find, or even ask for? Hey Shelle, lets go get some coffee, or talk to me Michelle. Simple, yet so f-ing hard to do! I dont understand!!!! If he had chosen one of those, things would have been fine, and it would have been over. Just pull out some sensitivity, dont be an ass and run from what bothers you. gerrrrrrr Im in the mood for Jeff Buckley, but mad at the fact that it reminds me of him. Mika and i are going for a walk.

Right now is a time in my life that i need to do alot of thinking about what i want to do, and where i want to go. If i had the money i would get my own place and just get my life together. Its really hard when you always have someone there and dosent give you much time to think about the things that you need. I have a problem of doing what others think i should do, or what they think is best for me. And then i never have time to think about what is best for me. I would like to move in with Jason and be his roomate, to help him out with bills and to keep him company. We hang out all the time with each other anyways, it sorda just makes sense. But at the same time i have feelings for Jason, and i dont want to move in and it not work, then we will lose our friendship. I love Jason with all my heart, and i dont want to move out and us not get along. We are both stubborn and hard headed, and sometimes we clash. But that is everyone and that is life. But if i were to take that big step and move in, and i find out that is not what i really want, then i lose Jason as a bud and a possible reationship. I dont want that to happen, so is there anyway around this situation? I think its kinda like jump in or drown. He keeps on me about moving in , and i have put him off way to long as it is already. Just scared, and dont want to lose what i have now, but the people around me are tired of me not knowing what i want. So its a chess move.....I dont know how to play chess.....crap Jason makes me smile, and he enjoys my stupid humor. And every so often i think that he likes my Ghetto side. I love to hang out with him, and want more sometimes. But more, comes with a price, and im broke and for a loss of words. On the other note Mika is well, and her knows that she might have a new home. A home without a fence, but we will work on getting that done as well. I would like to be alone and read and think about things. Turn on the music and relax and zone out as much as i can. My life dosent seem to allow that at this point. I would love to write and draw my thoughts and feelings, who knows mabye i will come up with something good! I talked to Thomas today for a bit, he is busy still doing his drawings. Im glad that he has something to keep him busy, so he dosent get caught up in harsh reality so much. Life is what you make of it, what will i make of it. What will become of me? When i am 60 years old, will i be happy with the choices that i have made? Will never be able to know, until im there, that is the scary part. One of the best feelings is when i shave my legs and i have a warm hand that slides down them. Or when i shave them and get under some new sheets...oh yeah.... I love sweat covered bodies after and during sex, makes you feel that you are really into what is going on. I love to be told that he loves me, or just plain talk dirty to me. I love music to be played or i love to simply hear the rain when there is a storm or a drizzle. I love soft looks, and healthy kisses. I love the act of full sillyness when you are in danger of crying together. Or an evening when every thing flows right, and there are no weird answers to anything. I love to sit outside when there is a slight breeze. Sno cones are great when eaten together.......... Adopt a Honda? need more love and willingness...

Last night it rained and rained hard, along with some hail mind you. The first thing i thought about was Sabina, so i called J up and asked him if it was raining over there. I should have known that it wasnt because i always get the bad weather, and j slips by with the simple stuff. OK, someone at work has total cuteness going for him, growl! But not my type, but i sure can enjoy is looks. Mellissa from work asked me today if i was mad at her, i responded with a no. I told her that i had alot going on and that i was not trying to snub her. She seemed so thrilled when she found out that everything was cool. Its wierd, kinda makes me feel bad, but kinda makes me feel good. At least i know that they think alot about me to care if i am mad at them or not. Last night was nice, i watched two shows on WE, Cinematherapy!!! I really am starting to love that channel. I watched " He loves me, he loves me not" with Claire Danes, wierd movie, but i could relate, that might be the scary part about it. And then the other movie i watched was "No looking back" it had Bon Jovi in it, and Lauren Holly. I could relate to that movie as well. And they really wernt that korny or sappy. So guys might dig it. But it was nice, to watch and think about "what if" and to read "Tropic of Cancer" by: Henry Miller....and read by Anais Nin....so you know its good stuff! eroticly smart reading. And with the rain pounding down on the roof and windows, it made for a pleasnt evening. I need more evenings like that, to myself, and get lost in endless romance. I have been getting alot of E mails from Joni, her and Charity want to hang out, so i figure that it will happen soon. My mom has been sorda keeping in touch, and thats wierd, but accepted. I started to write a little last night, but didnt get far. I tried to do it in the middle of commercials. Well lunch is almost here and i havent a clue of what to eat, i shouldnt eat much to be honest, her needs to lose pounds. Mika gives the wink, and we are good to go. 1. Do not walk behind me, for I may not lead. Do not walk ahead of me, for I may not follow. Do not walk beside me either. Just pretty much leave me the hell alone. 2. The journey of a thousand miles begins with a broken fan belt and a leaky tire. 3. It's always darkest before dawn. So if you're going to steal your neighbor's newspaper, that's the time to do it. 4. Sex is like air. It's not important unless you aren't getting any. 5. Don't be irreplaceable. If you can't be replaced, you can't be promoted. 6. Never test the depth of the water with both feet. 7. If you think nobody cares if you're alive, try missing a couple of car payments. 8. Before you criticize someone, you should walk a mile in their shoes. That way, when you criticize them you're a mile away and you have their shoes. 9. If at first you don't succeed, skydiving is not for you. 10. Give a man a fish and he will eat for a day. Teach him how to fish, and he will sit in a boat and drink beer all day. 11. If you lend someone $20 and never see that person again, it was probably worth it. 12. If you tell the truth, you don't have to remember anything. 13. Some days you are the bug; some days you are a windshield. 14. Don't worry; it only seems kinky the first time. 15. Good judgment comes from bad experience, and a lot of that comes from bad judgment 16. A closed mouth gathers no foot. 17. Duct tape is like the Force.
