She is just a sweet person. Thomas made me laugh my butt off tonight, he is so funny and drugged up on antibiotcs! Hes funny..... His bud is coming into town soon, that will be intresting.. Talked to dad yesterday, hes doing good and working too hard. He says that winter might be moving in soon! Gotta run and get back to RP!

Its Sunday, wasnt it just Sunday the day before yesterday? Ah well, who am I to get lost in time, after all time is usually not on my side to begin with. This weekend has been relaxing and sweet. Not as cold as it could have been, but can catch a nipples eye at night. As long as the sun stays out during the day, this Texan thinks its bearable. Very quiet and slow weekend as appose to the constant hustle and bustle of the upcoming work week. Christmas is way too far away and I am counting the days. YES I am a kid at heart, thank ya very much! There is nothing wrong with still believing in Santa *wink*! Mika is sniffing around all the packages wondering where all her gifts are. And the living room is packed with them, kinda makes you wonder how much money you have really spent on this stuff! I received the Barnes and Noble membership catalog in the mail, and thought that I would put an X by everything I wanted (so I would not forget). Yeah, well the marker almost ran out of ink, lol. Last night 10:00 store run was for: Cookie Dough Cokes Hair dye Oh yeah, im such an interesting girl, I tell ya! Got to run, see ya

Watched the Gospel of John, YEAH its good!Is it wrong to say that Jesus was sexy? (Bad shelle) urlLink Gospel of John Last night i also watched Mona Lisa Smile (at the rave). urlLink Mona Lisa Smile For those that do not live close to me, there is only two movie theaters that i normally go to: urlLink The Rave urlLink Market Street (Independent Films) My mom(texas) tried to do the same thing as she did last year. Saying that she does not matter to me and blah blah blah. I finally broke and bucked up to her for once in my life. And she apologized, sorda. Thats all it took for me to be halfway happy about the situation. If you read back to last Christmas i might have written about it, eh. In other news, last week i went with Thomas and Robert to pick up their bud Josh from the airport. I actually had a good time hanging out in the airport for about 2 hours or so. We just hung around and talked, made fun of each other and looked out onto the runway. It made me feel like i was traveling, but was a tease at the same time. The airport is a funny place all in all. A airport is my fav. place to people watch, i like to imagine what they are thinking and where they are going and what kind of people they are all around. Thomas would try to guess what people had in their bag. It was funny. Robert just kind of hung around and went with the flow of things. I actually had my feelings hurt, perhaps it was something stupid, but at the time, it hurt my feelings, so it matterd. I didnt eat before i left with them because i thought that we were going to get something to eat. Well the place was closed inside the airport at like 8:30. (Yeah our little airport sucks) Im used to my DFW! But there is a waffle house that is close and Thomas and i were hungry. Robert looked a little worried and really not up to the idea, so i said that we will wait until josh got there to eat. So i waited another hour or so. Then josh arrived and we were walking out to the car. When they first picked me up from the house i was going to sit in the back adn let Thomas and Robert up front. They insisted that i sit up front, so i said ok. Well when all of us were getting in the car to leave the airport, Robert said "Im sorry michelle, but i have to say that josh gets shotgun". I said nothing and went to the back seat. Not to mention that all they were going to do was take me home, they still had another hour to drive or so. Humm, i kinda found that a tad rude. But all in all i had no problem sitting in the back. Then Robert asked josh if he was hungry, he said that he really was not, but didnt flat out say NO ya know? Well i had been waiting for a little over 3 hours now to eat, so robert was like ok, and took me home. Didnt even ask if Thomas or I would like to stop somewhere. Im sure that josh would have not had a problem with hanging for about 30 min with us while we ate. I never get to see these guys that often anyways! So yeah, i had some grinding of the teeth going on. Mabye its because i am the type of person that always thinks of others before myself, i mean everyone that i am with...I dunno, just kinda chapped my hide. Im over it... I pulled out the little pictures that Thomas did for me a while back, and there wonderful. Christmas is almost here, and im siked! Mika looks around for her stocking. Jason and i went and got 4 new tires on Sabina today, they were well needed and road trips are coming up soon! Thats 450.00 gone.Dad western unioned me some money for my christmas presents since i would not be there on Xmas. He has nothing really to share, but yet gives me so much. It cause i am a daddys girl, and loving every min. of it! heh Talked with Jeremy last night and he was wanting to hang out some time, but i dont know when i will be able too!Ken has been calling, and I have found some great people on nerve.com. Not bad for a week, ha. Gotta run and get Santas tracking number, so i know when he will be on my roof top

Sunday i have been lazy lazy, and i think that i deserve it! I have been laying around the house and ran with J to best buy to pick up a chair. His broke and it was actually kinda funny watching him sit in it tilting to the side and all the way down. My wicked humor per say. I am back now, thinking about the busy upcoming work week, ugh. BUT that means that we will be getting closer to Christmas, thats how im looking at it now. I am having my first cup of Hot coco this year. YUMM! Grandma is doing a tad better, but the doctor told her that it will get worse before it gets better, damn what a thing to say, heh. Gotta run....bye bye

The holidays are just about over and i have one stop to go before they really are. Iowa here we come, in a day or so i will be off to Iowa. To see family and friends, and mabye i will be able to hop on the Casino boat once more. Even if its only a couple of bucks that i spend its always a good time! Dallas was awesome and i stayed a tad longer than i normally would have. I had several friends leave there name and address for me. when i moved i left everyone behind and never looked back, it was just a bad situation. I contacted one bud named Dalores. She was my best friend back in the day and we had so much fun, hunting guys down and screaming at them. I met up with her after 3-6 years on no talking. It was crazy but very cool. She is now married with a kid! Every single one of my friends have kids and have been married or are now divorced. It was kinda crazy to go back years later and see people still living at their parents house with the same ride or the same life. Its like stepping back in time and seeing that nothing had changed,very strange. I had moved several times and have done alot of things since then. Just makes ya think! There is a picture of dalores and i in my photos! I am back to find out that my fish is no longer alive, very sad for me, i loved that little guy. Mika went with me and we had a blast, i have some new pics of her as well! Santa was good to me this year! Came back sick, sore throat, congestion, not nice shit!

Thomas has put a boot to me once again about my blog, i have not been a good girl when it comes to getting this thing done in the proper manner. I went to my dads last weekend to have our christmas and i had a good time. I met his wifes son for the first time and hes not bad. He is 20 and recently moved here from New Orleans. He thinks the same way i do when it comes to this town just not moving fast enough. He lives with my dad and margie. He told me that my dad had a heart of gold and that he has helped him out so much. That he would do anything for him. He said that my dad did not even know him when he sent him money to get to his house, and that meant alot to him. He said that he considers my dad "his dad". That was really hard to grasp, seeing how i am his real kid. It was only hard to grasp for about 10 min or so. Im glad that others would consider my dad to be good enough for them. In other news, jason has been gone alot and working too much. I have seen him about once this week and he should be back tomorrow night. Last night i went out and job hunted. I didnt even go home, i went straight to the stores. I got home about 8 and was pooped. I have been having headaches for the past week and thats not normal for me. I pretty sure its not because im semi-sick, so im kinda wondering about it. When i bend over it just throbbs. Mika is happy to be home, but she misses all of her new friends that she has met on her journeys. I went over and took pictures of jeremy Monday night after having dinner with mom. I have them on a cd adn ready to give to him. Micheal here at work, has the hots fo shelle. I can just tell, plus he told me that my voice was very sweet and soft. yeah yeah, put another one on my list.....but no one likes shelle! Robert called me when i was in huntsville and wanted to know if i would meet up with Josh and him. Josh was going back to the airport and i hated that i was not able to tell him bbye like i would like to have. I told him to tell josh that im sorry that i missed him and that i hope to see him real soon. Talked to Thomas for awhile last night on the phone, that was really cool. I think it was the most that we have ever talked and it was supa sweet. Ken has called a time or two and i have talked to him. I need to go over there and get my boxes, eh. My stepdad (moms hubby) sister died yesterday. She had cancer and her funural will be this saturday, i plan on going. I have no idea what i will do tonight. I feel really funny since i have not eaten all day and its now 4:48. I need to get some crackers and mabye go job hunting once mroe. You can never have too many people wanting to hire ya right? I have talked to Blake a time or two this week and every day on messenger...he wants to meet for coffee, hummm mabye, mabye not! He wants to see Mika's bag, and that makes him ok in my book , heh. Gotta go and shut down the job......kisses

Today is a very rainy and yucky day, figures that it would be on the weekend. I had an interview today for a 2nd job. I went in and looks like i have good chances of getting in, even tho they just hired some other people. I have to go on my lunch break on Monday and take my pee test. Office Depot is where i might be spending my extra time. I always said that i never had enough time to do anything, but NOW i will really never have enough time. Everyone needs money and i am no acception im afraid. I tried to make reservations at Oaklawn (Horse track) yesterday and they were all booked, maybe next weekend. I felt really bad that i was not able to hang out with Chris this weekend because of everything else i had going on. I hope that he is not too mad at shelle. I have not talked to thomas yet this weekend, and thats odd, ehe usually keeps me in line. I will be going to watch the cooler tomorrow at Market Street. I will come back with the details on that later. Mika hates the rain, its too nasty on her fur, and her momma dont mind it on her fur that much, heh.

One of those wanna bees My stomach is nervous like the first person is a high trampeaze act. He opens the door and motions me in with a look of restlessness. The door closes behind me and i all i could do was swallow hard. he fumbles for his matches in his pocket, meant for the ciggs, in his other.He leans forward and lights a candle, forgetting about the switch that is less than a foot from him?He looks at me and motions "wait here" with his finger.He wanders into the room off his enchanting living room that is smaller than my bathroom. I take this chance to look around not moving my 7 1/2s. He reappears and takes my hand, leading me into the bedroom. There is a black light on and a comfy looking mattress on the floor. "Well, i guess hes not crazy enough to do the full light theory" she thinks to herself. He starts to take off his clothes and his hands get caught in his shirt, i cant help but give a smirk at his persistance. Just to help him i reach and take care of his belt buckle in case he injured himself in trying to do so. He throws his shirt on the floor, but not without hitting the lampshade on the way over and down. He takes my shirt and starts to lift it over my head, his hands are shaking and now it seems that i am in control, and he is nervous. Pulling it up and over he catches my earrings and i can remember my mom saying "if you wear big earrings they are just gonna get caught on things". The shirt is off and my bra is getting there. Now i am fully naked and he has his boxers to go. Noticing the bright yellow smiley Joe Boxer face with the tongue hanging out where his other friend is. I have to let an eye roll slip and suck it up. He looks really good though. His arms very nice and strong, the softness of his skin is almost magical, so it makes it all worth while. He looks at me like a puppy in a pet store and i attempt to remove his last article of clothing. We move closer and the whites of our eyes in the black light is freaky but sexy. We hit the bed and our bodies finally completley touch, pure softness of skin on such a rugged day. He stops and looks at mewith such intent and says " " You can pick the ending.... A) If i forget to tell you later, i had a really good time tonight. B) Please hurry, she will be home soon. C) Scream my name and never get tired! D) Did you happen to catch the Knicks game? This is just a story that can happen and end in any way. But no matter what you pick, keep in mind that all of these selections are happening all around us every day. Think about the one that turns you on the most. Happy Picking.... If you picked A- You are the romantic and in love with the fairy tale. If you picked B- You are a risk taker and not happy in one way or another. If you picked C- You are looking for a great fuck and a good exercize routine. And you fancy yourself. If you picked D- You are not that worried about getting that some, and chances are you gamble. Because if you are that hard up for asking a girl during sex, then you bet high roller on that game!

THRU THE EYES OF PURPLE~ For all the shades of purple can mean what you want them to mean. The purple passion of love, or mabye the purple passion of lust. The darkness in her heart, and that lump that forever grows in her breast. The wet eyelashes to the wet nail. The corrupt world and the farmers daughter. The depressed person to the "my life is never better" girl continuing to fool herself. To fool those that are not routine are simple. To fool those that are more than, is a life of dedication. To the salt water that tickles my toes, to the unforgiven kiss that you never recieved. A slap on the wrist for those that do not follow a life your mother would love to lead, a slap in the face once they realize the real you. The last couple of days have been a bitch and a half for me. I have no idea what it is or what brought it on, its just one of those things. Work has been busy before i even log in to my computer to stopping at five (because i have too) and knowing that i have tons of work to do. Then when i get home, i try to relax, but just cant get my mind at ease enough. I tend to get ticked off rather easy for things that i usually let go. Its been an up and down emotional rollercoaster and dammit i want off! Im hoping that this weekend will bring some comfort to my inner self and let things go. I have not been able to talk to many of my buds this week because i have been so busy, or so strained that i can't bare to talk. My ciggs have been quite the comfort, but even they start to taste bad, eh. I still have not heard word on Office Depot, they better call me back because im not in the mood for this, ha. I know that it takes like 3-4 days to get my pee test results back and they told me to call them if they get too busy to call me. But, is today the day i should call? geez.. Im trying to rush me getting another job, im just plain crazy.. It is cold outside and damn when the wind blows its kinda no joke, but this is coming from someone who has not worn a coat this week! I would love a carmel mach. some ciggs, and a good surrounding.

I have treated myself twice this week with a Carmel Mach. from Starbucks! oh yumm, i just cant help myself, but all the while studying HTML, so im not a total bad girl. Just found out today that my boss has cancer in his liver and chances are that he is not going to make it. That makes three people in our department that have got cancer in the last year. Now its really hitting close. I couldnt help my emotions when i was told and let my tears out. I have watched three people in my family die from cancer and several people here at work, there mothers have died of cancer and one within the last 2 weeks. My grandmother had breast cancer and my aunt had lung cancer, i have seen them suffer thru too much. So all i can do is pray and hope that everything will be ok.

I know i know, i have been a bad girl as far as not writing. For those of you who do not know, i have a second job and i have been working there for a week now. My birthday turned out to be something that i didnt see coming. When i got home Jason had happy birthday banners up a balloon. There was wonder-fully purple flowers that filled the room with the sweet aroma. There were two cards one said "mama" and the other said "shelle". I opened the one that said Mama, and it was from Mika and if you know Mika you know that she loves to eat. So her card was about eating pie! And on the inside there was a picture with Mika in a birthday hat licking her lips. It was the cutest picture! Then there was a big purple package sitting close by. I went ahead and opened it and right on top was another picture of Jason and Mika in her Birthday hat, it was the cutest! Turned out that he got me my Klipsch speakers!!! I was so excited and cant wait to hook them up! Then after that, jason baked me a cake and made me purple frosting for the cake, it was so sososssssooo yummy. HE actually put the candles in the shape of a twenty-four and let me blow them out! (first try if i might ad, i guess im full of hot air, lol) Then he handed me a peice of paper, it was a recipt from my dentist, he paid by 112. dollar balance for me. wow. He told me to close my eyes and led me to the back porch, he said that this was from someone else. I opened my eyes and there was my picture that Thomas PRomised me that he would have to me on my birthday. and sure enough he did. It was awesome and huge! I guess i didnt think that it would be that big and now i have to try and find a place for it! It had all kinds of purple shades and was just damn cool. After that Jason and i headed off to the Olive Garden where i was meeting up with mom, sis,BJ, and lizzy. We ate and told perverted three nipples jokes and had a great time. I opened my gifts there and had some coffee after wards. Went to Blockbuster and rented a comedy and a movie. Read a tad, waited till my birthday was over and then i closed my eyes, knowing that my day was over. Got up today and have to work of course, i also have to work tonight and then next three nights, eesh. Hang in there i say!

TODAY IS MY BIRTHDAY I am the old age of 24! My family has called and wished me good thoughts on my birthday. One person at work in my section rememberd that it was my birthday, and the other 3 or more didnt. And this is after i got them gifts for Valentines day and one of their birthday. This goes to show me what others would say to me is right. Its not the i want anything in return or expect rather, but they make a way more money than i and cant even try like i do. NOT NEXT YEAR, i am telling you, i will not throw myself out there for them and then live with the fact that im broke! Nope, another birthday and im a year smarter, try and catch me now! Other people in the building are coming up to me and wishing me happy b-day and sending me cards. Even a lady that no longer works here sent me a B-day card, and the people that work inches from me, dont remember. Just hacks me and makes me sad all the while. More on the birthday later

It has been so long since i have blogged that its hard for me to even start. I have been working so much that i have fallen out of the loop with my friends and my life that was pryor to the last month and a half. I feel like i am missing out on so many things because i am never in one spot at any lengh of time. I have been working at petco 6 days a week plus my full time day job. Thats 2 full time jobs that i am working and the second job has manager issues. The managers are lacking social skills like no tomorrow, they are the kind of people that make the employees feel like they are worth little more than just help. And its not just me, they had another manager that tried to put in her two week notice, they lost the whole grooming department and several floor workers. I have tried to stick it out and deal with the bullshit. I need the money and i love to work with the animals and that is what has kept me around. I love helping people with their problems and making sure that the store looks good. I have had other managers beg me not to quit along with co-workers that say if i go, they go. Ha.... I have bought a car, yes, i am still in shock. I decided to go ahead and not get the Honda right now. I thought that i would purchase this car and build some credit before i try and get what i really want. I purchased a 2001 Mits. Galant. Its very nice, leather interior,cd,air,power windows, keyless remote. Oh yeah, its the youngest car i have old, the only car i have old with air conditioning. Its a very big thing for me. I have not had my own car in over three years and this is over due. I love it. But of course now i have to think about car insurance, and my car payment, gas.eesh. I got a promotion at work, that i have worked my ass of for. Stuff is finally coming together in my life and i cant even fathom how long i have waited. My next door neighbor has a bitch for a girlfriend and he is just plain trash. They always peel out when they leave and have left the other side of my damn driveway a mudpitt. They have torn up my plants, flowers and its awful how it looks. They leav shit in my yard and i hated it. Never said shit to them, just bite my tongue to save jason embaressment, lol. his stupid ass ugly girlfriend was spinning out in the yard tearing shit up, and jason went out there to help her. the next night we are sitting in our living room and there was a loud knock on the door. When i opened the door he was pissed and shaking. He said "can i talk to jason" and i said "you can talk to us". We stepped out on the porch and he looked at jason and said that his girlfriend told him that jason jumped on her and had attitude with her.If you know jason you know that he is not mean, speacially not to women. I jumped in and got in his face. I told him that his girlfriend was a lier and she needed to stop it. I told him that i understand that he was going to believe her over us, but i can promise him that he needs to rethink himself. Told him that he did NOT need to come over to my house with attitude, because he will walk away with more than he bargained for. Went off on his ass about what they have been doing and he was shaking and makinga fist at times. I stopped and asked him "why are you shaking, why are you mad, quit doing that shit with your fingers". Told him that he had no damn respect for my shit, and that he needs to get his shit together. I was just so pissed that he could come up on us about this tiny little shit, when my anger for him had been growing for months. I was so in his face that im sure he was shocked, and had no idea that i could be that way. I was hopind that he would hit me, because i was gonna whale on his ass. then i finally said "look, this is getting us no where, let me assure that that your girl lied and that we can work this out". I dont want to live next to some one that i hate. Worked some things out and he left happy. BUT his girl, i wanna kick her ass so bad, all her dirty looks, but never never trying to look me in the eye. BITCH. I need to each lunch and get back to work, eesh. there is some of what is going on for now....

I have been dragging today, no energy. Working all day here at the state parks, and then working tonight at Petco. I am actually trying to tie the two together. We started our annual "Spring a Pet" Petco foundation, i have raised over 200 bucks in donations so far. We are planning of having a day playing music and cooking out at the store, to raise more donations for the cause. I thought that i would try and use my resources from my first job to help the second, so i am proposing a plan to have a interpreter from one of our state parks to come and give a program through out the day. They can teach the diffrence between "wild animals" and actual Pets. Trying to get our KAB department to try and help out as well, with working with pets and the enviroment. I had a semi-meeting with the director of state parks about my plan and he seems to be going for it. I brought him some information on the Petco foundation today and we shall see what goes down from there. I am still loving my car and here really soon my first car payment wiill start, eee gads. Insurance i am already paying and my other bills as well. Mika loves me working at petco because i constantly bring her treats home from the Pet Buffet Bar, yup she is spoiled. The weather is starting to turn into spring and getting a little warmer. I went and bought some elephant ears and some Hosta to go out in the flower bed. They should do rather well this year and i am curious to see. Thomas is thinking of coming down this way sometime soon,and robert sent me a badass birthday. Chris Haw sends me more e mails recently, and Jason is sweet. Last night i was outside on the porch when the lightning, thunder rolled in with rain soon to follow. Yeah it was real nice, we opened the windows and let the sweet wet air come right on in. Very nice and i cant help but think of the feeling all day today while i have been stuck at work.

If they days were any prettier i would have to take a step back. When spring hits its almost like you find out why you keep on going. The trees with buds, the plants full of green sprouts. Little Mika playing in the yard, and rolling in the grass with the tongue hanging out the side. Little moments like that just make me want to smile the best smile and laugh out loud. Spent some time with Thomas and Jason at the Barnes and a tad at the shoe store. Thomas is doing well and his paintings are awesome. Jason is traveling more to the parks and having a tad better of a time going in and out without so many computer problems. Chris H. is doing good i think, he is still in hawaii and i miss the guy. Just from e mails i can tell that he has changed a tad, but i will always do anything for him. Chris in Texarkana is doing well , he got into the art school that he wanted and his life is starting to perk up and he needs it for sure. Jeremy is telling me im sexy every 5 min, its cute, but he has to know that its not gonna go anywhere. Michael has been in hiding and re-appearing this week. Michael (hot springs) IS STILL calling the job and wanting to be my boyfriend. Eric finally found a truck and bought it. Ken is wanting to hang out and i cant seem to get the nerve. James wants it i know he does, he has 4 kids at 29, whoa. My other job wants me to be a manager, but i cant because i am only part time. They said that maybe i can be a team leader and open and close the store and do all the money at night. I hope so because that is 9 bucks an hour for a second job, not bad. Got my income tax in and not a moment too late, my first car payment is April 2nd. eesh, here that goes. The yard is coming along and the hosta is in bloom. Im happy, when the weather is like this, im happy to roll down the windows when i drive and turn the music up and just chill.

So Sunday was a wonderful day, the best day in a long time. Sunday Jason and i got up and started to run to plant shops and home depot for goodies for the yard. We had so much fun and it was a wondeful day outside, lower 70s with the sun as bright as it could be. We planted and listened to music, it was great. we bought 2 shepard hooks and here are some of the plants we bought. Jasmine- Common white jasmine or poets jasmine (Jasminum officinale) is hardy throughout the Midlands but questionable in the Upstate. Mature Height/Spread: Common jasmine grows to a height of 10 to 15 feet as a lanky, semi-vining shrub. When grown as a vine, its arching branches have to be supported on an arbor or trellis. To grow it as a shrub requires frequent pruning. The very fragrant, white flowers are up to 1 inch in diameter and they are present all summer and into fall. The rich green leaves have five to nine leaflets, each up to 2 inches long. Growth Rate: Common jasmine is moderately fast-growing. It grows 12 to 24 inches a year. Landscape Use: Plant jasmine near the house or near a walk so its intense fragrance can be enjoyed and so you can watch hummingbirds and butterflies come to the flowers. Cultivation: All jasmines prefer full sun to partial shade and a warm site. They grow well in regular garden soil with moderate levels of soil fertility and moisture, and they need frequent pinching and shaping to control growth. Low-growing, shrubby kinds make good hedges. Jasmines bush out and should not be jammed together. Set them at least 8 feet apart in shrub borders. Containerized plants are best planted in the fall. Problems: Common jasmine is relatively problem-free. Carolina Jessamine- Carolina jessamine is one of the most beautiful vines of the South. It covers fences and trees in open woodlands and along roadsides throughout the Southeast with its slender vines and bright yellow flowers. It is the state flower of South Carolina. MATURE HEIGHT/SPREAD Carolina jessamine grows to 20 feet or more when grown as a vine. It can also be grown as a ground cover, maintained with a yearly cutting in late spring after flowering to 3 feet or less. GROWTH RATE This vines growth rate is moderate, growing rapidly once established or with rich soil and adequate water. ORNAMENTAL FEATURES Sweetly scented, golden yellow flowers cover the cascading, fine textured foliage from February to April. The trumpet-shaped blooms are 1 to 1 inches long and are attractive to butterflies. The shiny evergreen leaves are 1 to 3 inches long on 10-to-20-foot tall vines. In colder areas of the state, it may be semi-evergreen and the leaves may turn bronze in winter. LANDSCAPE USE Carolina jessamine is easy to grow. It is attractive on an arbor where the slender branches hung with yellow flowers can be seen from below. This plant will stay in scale and can be used on decks and porches and near patios and entryways. It is good in containers and as a ground cover along steep banks to help control erosion. Carolina jessamine tolerates either full sun or partial shade. Flowering is more prolific and foliage growth is denser in full sun. This vine is very adaptable and will grow in a variety of conditions. For best results, plant it in rich, well-drained soil. Moist soil is ideal, but the vine is able to withstand periods of drought once established. Plant from containers during cool weather, spacing 3 feet apart for ground cover and 4 to 8 feet apart for wall or trellis climber. Fertilize while the plant is actively growing with moderate amounts of a balanced fertilizer. Do not overfeed, since excessive fertilizer can reduce flowering. Older vines that become top-heavy or sparse can be pruned back to a few feet above ground level after flowering. Remove dead or broken branches and shape the plant each year after bloom. Mow groundcovers every few years to maintain density. PROBLEMS All parts of this plant are poisonous. The sap may cause skin irritation in sensitive individuals. Children can be poisoned by sucking the nectar from the flowers. Insects or diseases rarely trouble Carolina Jessamine. Deer will not eat it. Hosta- Hostas are easy-to-grow, shade-tolerant perennials grown mainly for their beautiful foliage. HEIGHT/SPREAD The size of hostas varies greatly. The largest measures 4 feet in height with 20-inch-long leaves. The smallest collectors miniatures may be only a few inches across. Most hostas range between 1 and 2 feet tall. Growing conditions influence size. GROWTH RATE Hostas are very long-lived. Hostas may outlive their gardeners if given a good planting location and reasonable care. ORNAMENTAL FEATURES Hosta leaves come in many shapes, colors, sizes and textures. The leaves grow as clumplike mounds in colors ranging from yellow-green to dark green to blue-green. Variegated forms are common. Hosta leaves may be rounded to oval, heart-shaped or strap-like. The leaf may be flat, have a wavy edge or have an interesting puckered texture. Hostas are also grown for their flowers, which are produced from early summer to fall depending on the species and cultivar. Flowers may be white, lavender or purple. Some hostas are fragrant. PROBLEMS Garden slugs are the most common problem of hostas. The most popular remedy is saucers of beer, which attract slugs, and then they drown. Use caution if you use slug baits since they can also poison pets. Space plants further apart. Hostas will change color or fade if they are in too much sun. Most blue hostas need shade. In full sun, leaf color is pale and leaf dieback may occur, especially during dry periods. Yellow and cream edges may brown during dry periods. Blue-leafed cultivars sometimes fade to green if the waxy leaf covering that gives them their color is rubbed off by strong rain storms or vigorous watering. Voles and deer can be a problem if wildlife is active in your area. Foliar nematodes can also be a problem. Buy new plants in late summer or fall so you can check for infestation. Do not purchase plants that show browning in between leaf veins. Hosta anthracnose can cause large whitish spots with brown edges to form on leaves and stalks. Remove the damaged leaves. LANDSCAPE USE Hostas prefer areas that are partly shaded or shaded. Some cultivars are sun-tolerant, but all do best if they receive shade in the afternoon. Hostas prefer well-drained soil with plenty of organic matter. Hostas need plenty of moisture during the growing season to support the growth of their large, soft leaves. They will need an inch or more of water per week if not supplied by rains. If the weather is very hot or the plants are in sun or subject to root competition from trees and shrubs, they will need more water. In early spring after the first growth starts, apply a well-balanced, slow-release fertilizer. Avoid excessive fertilizer rates. Plant, transplant and divide hostas either in the early fall or in spring before leaves unfold. While hostas can be successfully divided at any time that they can be dug, they will need much more care if divided during summer heat. Divide hostas by either cutting away a section of a clump with its roots or by lifting the clump and separating it. Be sure to use clean, sharp tools. Replant the new plants promptly and water well. Space plants 1 to 3 feet apart, allowing room for growth. Hostas do best when left undisturbed for several years. Remove flower stalks after bloom to encourage vigorous growth, rather than seed production. Remove hosta leaves and clean up around the plants after they have died back in the fall to help control diseases and slugs. SPECIES AND CULTIVARS There are more than 2,000 registered cultivars of hosta grown today. The species and cultivars mentioned below are just a few of those that are well-suited to growing throughout South Carolina. But the cable eventually started to not work so this was next. Last night J and i hit up the local barnes and nobles, nothing like a coffee and a conversation. Before we went in we were sitting in the car having some dinner, and this girl gets into the car next to us and does not relize that we were in the car because my windows are dark tinted. She gets in and lets her car door open right on to mine, and she looks over. I just stuck out my hand and pointed at her. Jason rolls down the window as she was starting to back up and she kills the car in fright. She starts the car again and took off. It was funny to scare her, but i was mad that people are not more careful these days. I always hold the door as i am getting in if i am close to another car. Jasons honda has so many little marks on it where people have done that. Just lack of respect, and i know that she will think twice about it where ever she parks again. Still loving Sarah and Beth to the fullest, and mika is full of love. Thomas how are you? Chris i miss ya, and we all need to hang in there!!!! Kisses and love bye-bye

After reading the blog of Thomas I am so jealous of his past week. Thomas went to New Orleans and had a blast. Drinking, Art, Drawing and Friends, Yeah that's a good time. He wrote about his adventures and lusts and loves. Thomas needed this break, im so siked that he was able to hit the road. I miss the road trips something awful and its prime time to do it. Was thinking about the things that I am grateful for and decided to jot some things down. I am grateful for: Good educated friends Past relationships (you learn something from everyone of them) Good eclectic music My two dogs Mika and Isobel My two jobs (we have to make a living somehow) Sunny days with nice wind, and rainy days to sleep with My health (even tho I don't take care of myself to the best extent) Independent Films People who say what you always wanted to say For those who don't tune in on a daily basis, you might have missed the stations where I grab my groove! urlLink Radio Paradise I stream RP all day long every day, love the music and the vibe it gives off You should hop into the forums as well, good people, good conversations urlLink Soma Awesome sounds to fall asleep too, and to groove with in the wee late hours Salad and Beat Blender are good ones, but you should explore all! urlLink KCRW An awesome educational station, for those who want anything and everything They actually had Beth Orton in an interview once, so yeah, there awesome! Sitting here on this Friday and im siked, its not that much longer till I call it a day, until 6 anyways. It is supposed to rain tomorrow and it looks like I might not go see pop. Blake how are you? Thomas im so over jealous! Chris H. How is Hawaii right now? Chris (ark) how is school coming? Robert I LOVED MY BIRTHDAY CARD, are you still drawing? Jason take it one step at a time. Ken, I know time is getting old, how is Ginger? Eric, congrats on your new ride, sorry bout the stiff car bills. Darryl, you crack me up and your so laid back for the lifestyle you have. Ed, damn im sorry I have not contacted. Kevin I think about you sometimes. Have you ever thought that you have so much passion for things in life, and your words don't seem to match? The sun is such a wonderful medication, and life really is too short. I want to walk the cobble streets in a villa some where outside of time and laugh, smile and take deep breaths. Would love to sit on the corner of a coffee shop have damn good conversation and Java. (perhaps some cheesecake too) Would like to be in a Amazon like Forrest and have wild sex, anyone with me on that one? One of the best feelings to me is to be out in the sun all day long having fun in the water, and then taking a shower and getting all fresh again. Then going out for awhile and getting some good food. You know the feeling when you swim all day and your starving!oh yeah, swimming and eating grapes in awesome too. BAD PART: getting out of the pool and having to go in a air conditioned house, damn thats cold! Just the feeling of being worn out and relaxing is quite nice.

I thought that i was gonna throw Izzy across the room last night, eesh. When i got Izzy i knew that it was alot of responsibility and i had already gone thru that with Mika. When i was on my way to work last night i knew that Izzy was going to be very hyper because she was in a crate while i was at work, so i prepared for that. When i got home Izzy had pulled the treat bag thru the cage and there were treats all over the place for her and Mika to eat. I didnt get on them because that was my fault that i didnt put the bag up higher. Izzy went potty outside like a good girl and wanted to play when we got inside. I was so tired but knew that i needed to play with her because she deserved that. She wanted to go ahead and pee in the house, and i had to take her oustside to show her that she needed to go outside. I was hungry so i went and made me a bowl of cerial. I sat down on the couch and Izzy was running around with a sock of mine. I had to put my cerial on the coffee table and get the sock from her. As i got the sock, she darted towards my cerial, head first she went. I got her away and this was five min. of me dragging her away from my cerial bowl and mika wanting some food and me trying to get the cerial bowl. I put her in her cage for 5 min. and then let her back out again. She persisted to chew on things other than her toys thru-out the evening. I was up and down off the couch for most of the night. I had had it and the only way i was going to get rest was to go to bed. I put izzy in her cage and went to bed. Izzy didnt want to be in her cage and whined. I put a pillow over the my head and went to sleep. About 6 this morning i opened a eye to the sound of Izzy whining. I thought i had been asleep for 5 min. and i was awoke by her again. I got up and opened the cage for her and Mika to go outside. Izzy took off toward the bedroom and did a runny number two all over a sweater and the floor. Handling one puppy in one arm and trying to get mika to go oustide, while having the soiled clothes in the other hand. I threw the clothes in the washing machine and started it. I took Izzy outside for her to go potty and all she wanted to do was play. We came back inside and i needed to take a bath. I locked Izzy in the bathroom with me and she whined because she could not get into the bath tub. While i was shaving my legs she wanted to chase the razor and chew on it. Finally half way dressed and ready to go to work. Put izzy back in her cage and took off. While i was on my way to work, i was thinking whoa im going to work to get away from it! ha I knew and prepared myself for the puppy stage before i got her. Puppys can just work the nerve! I love her tho and she is a wonderful baby girl! Had a talk with Mika last night about how much i appreciated her, but knew that I trained her to be how she is. And thats the goal with little Izz-bot.

Over the weekend i had another addition to my family. Her name is Isobel. I got her on Saturday night about 8 o'clock when i went back to look at her for the second time. She is a 7 week old Pomeranian. She is registered with papers just like Mika. Not that having papers really matters because i am not a breeder and dont plan on having them bred. Just to show that they have a good bloodline. She is wonderful and Mika has taken to her very well. They play together and Mika acts like she is her baby, she protects her. So, right now we are going thru the potty training and chewing stages, i did that 4 and a half years ago with Mika. I crate trained Mika and i shall do the same with izzy (isobel). Things that she loves to chew on the most: The oriental Rugs Socks Curtains Shoes and any paper that she can find The other day upon coming to work i put new newspaper in her crate. When i came home for lunch to let her out, there was no newspaper and there was none around the area. ummm, did she eat it? What a little terd! Jason pratically refuses to clean up any accidents she might make in the house, so its all up to momma. It was fun shopping for some chew toys, collar, and some treats. Her little face, i sware, she is the cutest thing ever. I try to pay extra close attention to Mika because i dare not want her to feel like she is being left out in any way. After all, she will always be my favorite! I got a postcard from Thomas while he was in New Orleans, THANKS! It was such a pretty card and i loved it. Nice to know that you are thought of.... Today Jason left to go to some parks and i had to drive his car home from work. The breaks are weird. Its like ever so often when you are stopped they will ease the way to the floor. My first thought is a hole in the break line, but there has never been any leaking anywhere. So i took it to a firestone place today and dropped it off. They called me and said they could not find a thing wrong with it. So that means i will have to take it to the Honda dealership, and thats a arm and a leg. Im thinking that its the drum that is by passing and therefore not leaking out on the ground. Maybe its leaking inside the drum, eesh. I called the Honda place and asked them the amount on the part and labor....here it is...a whopping 285.00. DAMN. Honda's are good cars, but very expensive to fix. Jason does not know that i took it, heh, was hoping to have it fixed before he comes back. Looks like that wont happen. oh well. I have to work tonight and i hope that goes smooth. My dad is moving to a new house, he is getting off the mountain. I need to go there with weekend and see where he is moving too. He has not seen my new car,Isobel, or me in awhile. Plus he has a new Pom puppy that i have not seen. His puppy is just like Mika, black and a tad bit grey. He has a boy and i have two little girls. Pictures of Mika and Izzy are coming soon! Well i have rattled on long enough, later guys!

I just finished watching "My life without me", whoa, you want to talk about a powerful movie. Full of emotion, heartbreak,games and pure life. urlLink My life without me Watching this movie I have looked back on life with a new lease on ideas. But the sad part about it is im not sure how long this feeling will last. Have you ever watched a movie that made you cry, and want to change your life. You have such passion about it at this time between the ride home and when you wake up, but soon after you slip right back into your normal living slot. I have seen and heard about the death that surrounds the dreaded word cancer. My boss has been forced into retirement and now cant seem to remember his name on occasion from all the morphine. Two aunts of mine and my grandma died from cancer. (breast cancer and lung cancer) I watched them die for hours and days, its horrible, it allows you to suffer and think about if you brought it on yourself. And here I sit and smoke a pack a day, what is wrong with me. I don't want to quit that's the problem, I like them. And for that reason I am scared that quitting will not work for me. damn. I will quit and soon, I have to at least try, right? I am so worried that I can quit now and my lungs look like new, then when I am 35 the doctor says I have cancer from years early. Is there any escape? people that don't smoke, get cancer. We are looked down upon in public, you may not notice because you do not pay attention. The way people go out of there way to get around you and your habit if you are lit up. The "no smoking" signs seem to push you more and more away from the buildings. The "WE ID" signs screaming at you in the grocery and convient stores. We are "litter bugs" because of our butts. The no smoking in bars anymore. WHAT? I say have smoking and non smoking bars, its your choice what bar you go too right? Why don't they just make them illegal, ill tell you why, because more people would be in jail, and you know how bad they are already crowded. You know a cigg is worth way more than an ass whooping in jail too! Back in the 20s it was sexy to smoke. Yeah sure we may not have known JUST how bad they were, but they knew it was not a bowl of fruit either. eh. Who am I kidding, I just need to quit because I don't want to be without the people that I love and to not be able to live life. I don't want a time limit on life..... Mom wants me to come over this weekend for a party that she is having at her house. I don't want to break it to her that I might go see daddy. I really need to! Thomas is coming in town this weekend to watch Kill Bill II, and I will not be here. Sorry Thomas, IM sure you will enjoy the movie all the while. Blake, my dear Blake I am sorry that I have been so busy, but I know you understand. List of things to do: Need to check oil in car Pluck eyebrows paint toenails and fingernails burn some cds work on Isobel's potty training harder read a good book like "Tuesdays with morrie" clean room some more read more cultural literacy wash hair get some rest blow everyone kisses

Nothing way out exciting to post here today, just me living the life. I have had some days off, not as much as i needed, but some is better than none. I have been playing with Izzy and Mika and loving the fact that its getting warmer. I need to clean my room like mad and i have been putting it off for weeks. Tell me that is not bad! ha. I think im going to see papa this weekend, double excited about that. Wondering how well Izzy is going to do. This will be her first long trip, eesh, it could be rough. Right now i am listening to Jeff Buckley waiting on the time to pass. I have been up to my ears in paperwork today and the day has been so busy, but the time has stopped totally. Had some attitude from the co-workers nothing new. Last night Jason and i went Easter Candy shopping. You know that the day after the candy is like 50% off! Our coffee table is covered with candy, its pathetic i know. It was like we went out and mugged a couple of kids on halloween,awesome. For those of you who still want some candy, get out there and get your candy at a discount!!! heh

Today has been quite an eye opener. Eric, Jason and I went to eat lunch today. We stopped by the house and I let Isobel and Mika out to potty while the guys went to the bank. Isobel and Mika were good girls. The guys came to pick me back up and we went to the mall to grab some grub. On the way back to lunch across from the blind school on the curve of Markham there was an accident. It was very recent because the smoke was coming from the cars and no one was there. The two people were still in there vehicles. I told Jason to pull over because I had to help them. I ran up to the guy and asked him if he was ok, he had a big gash in his head and was bleeding. I told him to stay there while I went to check on the other person. I walk up to the maroon honda accord and look inside. It was a lady that works in our history commission. She looked up at me and said my name, I told her to relax and don't move. I asked her where she was hurting and she said her chest and foot. I told her that her chest prob hurts because of the seat belt and the air bags. I didn't want to tell her that she might have broken her foot or ankle. I asked her what I needed to get so when the ambulance gets here she will have her stuff. She asked for her keys and I had to juggle it out of the ignition because it was smashed. I got her purse and shoes, and the cell phone out of the glove box. When they ambulance got there they could not get her doors open with the crowbar and had to get her out thru the back. Sucks too, her car was paid off and she wont get what the car is worth I know it. The other guy admitted that it was his fault. She was on her way back to work from lunch and he pulled out in front of her. Both cars were totaled. He was asking where his glasses were and I found them, they were on the other side of her car. He asked where I found them, when I told him he told me that he was wearing them at impact. The accident bent his frame and his car is no more either. Today was a very hectic day to say the least. Its one thing to get out and your heart is pounding as you approach the cars knowing they are strangers, and then seeing someone you know in the drivers seat, whew. I just got the hair out of her face and touched her cheek. Held on to her shoulder and tried to keep her talking. All you can do is tell her its gonna be ok, in this case it was. The song that popped in my head was "fast car" by Tracy Chapman. Everyone Drive safe and I love ya! I went to my sisters daughters third birthday party on Sat. Mom called and wanted me to be there by 1 so we could get the balloons blew up and what not. I showed up and carried her Easter basket in that I made for her. About 1:30 Petco calls asking me to come in that day and Easter Sunday, I just said yes. I left her birthday party and never got to see her open presents. Damn. I have to work tonight as well, yeah for shelle.

Today at 6pm i quit smoking. Holy crap, a little over 5 and a half hours and i am straight wanting a cigg. Geez, its gonna be hard but i need to do it, for myself and my dogs, ha. I have already got the cravings, so i went to the store and bought some fruit and veggies. I must rememeber to not eat bad food while i go thru this. I have seen people smoking since i have quit today and its so tempting. I hope that i can actually get thru this ok. I wanna kick the girls ass that gave me my first cigg, but i know that it was my choice as well.

I should not be up this early, 4 something...I should be asleep in my bed, thinking of warm fuzzies. I have been in wrenching pain for about 42 hours now, if not more. It was starting to get warm so I figured ill go and tan some. I never tan that much because I can tan pretty good by myself.Went in to a new place, didn't even an 30 like normal, they put me in for 15. Went and tanned, was good to go until about 9 or 10 that night. I turned red ALL OVER MY BODY and have pain like your would not understand. The next morning I couldn't sleep the bed feels like sandpaper.Got up about 5 am and was just throwing up and nauseated. Clothes hurt like hell and im not going there with a bra. Got up and went to the doctor, and had a steroid shot in my ass yesterday. (feels like a little pinch my ass)They don't tell you about it numbing up and feeling like your cheek will fall off for a sec or so.She told me to bend over and put my hands on the table, hehehe. Also got a prescibed some cream that I picked up at pharmacists yesterday. Here it is another day and I am in the same amount of pain.Cant sleep, shit I got at walgreens helps none, and no aspirin is working. Cant sit,lay,move,touch without cringing, and the worse thing is, I brought it up myself. (Michelle slaps head and repeats the word stupid) So I am here thinking of actually painting a little, Isobel is up with me already tearing stuff up. She loves for me to hold her, but she jumps on my burned skin with her nails, eesh. Need dog repellent. The dog adoption lady at work has a house for rent and for cheap. Went and wollowed around it yesterday, its awesome as hell, maybe I can see inside if it today. She will have a kennel there and I can take care of the dogs that they place there. That's cool for me because I love it. Who knows, will keep you posted.(bad thing, I have pulled off 3 ticks since yesterday from the land out there, not good on sunburn)Have to go to work today, how in the hell am I doing the bra, there is no damn way. I am red, but not near as red, and in the same pain, there is something wrong here. Watched Big fish and calendar girls in the last two days....I will marry Ewan McGregor I think, its his voice and smile, lets not forget his singing in Moulan Rouge.Billy Crudup is hot too, as in almost famous. urlLink Big Fish urlLink Calender Girls Eric i called and got no response, thomas have not talked to you! Chris in Hawaii, i got your e mail i need to write you back when i have ample time.Chris in Arkadelphia, i know i know i need to take the time and call you. Ed man its been awhile, i need to talk to you, if i have time i need to send you something.

Dealing with it the day after... My face is swollen and my eyes are heavy. People are walking by with the "I don't really know what to say" look on their face. Truth is, I really would not know what to say myself, just one of those quiet times. I have to move on and just deal with it. Yesterday when I was at the hospital I had a nurse stop because she saw me crying and asked "Is there anything that I can do"? I told her that I was just dealing with it, that I just had to deal with it. She asked "do you need someone to talk too, if so, I am here". I thought that it was an awesome gesture and just wanted to hug her neck. Not often do you just want to hug a strangers neck, but it does happen. I looked up with my dark red watery eyes and gave her a slight smile and politely told her no thank you. Watched a really awesome movie last night. It was one that i had been wanting to see, but just never got around to it. Then Netflix finally dropped it at my door and i knew that i had too. Bowling for Columbine, yes i know that i am far behind on that one. Anyways, if there is someone farther behind than me, please rent the movie. I think he has a new one out about Sept 11th and so on. Talked with Eric via E mail and he has something for tomorrow. I have no idea, but he seems siked about it.Have heard little from Thomas (what pictures)? Ken has not called today, i feel bad for that. Eric W. will be going to the drag strip with Jason, Robert and I in the next couple of weeks. Iowa is coming up quick and im excited to get away for awhile, even if its really a little while.

RIP-Russell Chris Peek Today has had a tragic end in some respect. My boss is gone from us. He passed away today about four. I left work to go see him in the hospital and soon after he passed. I have cried till I cant cry anymore, my face is swollen and my stomach is upset. I have so many questions and no answers, answers that will never come.I am going through the anger, the sadness and the blank stare stages that seem to come when its all over. Damn he was smart and so well "Chris". I am glad that he is gone for the fact that he was in so much pain, they had him on so much morphine. Will look for him in the paper tomorrow or the next. I need to paint, I need to, but cant see past the swelling and water wells.... When i read the post before this, i had no idea that it would be so soon, you just never know.

Things are hard for me right now, and i hope that the clouds soon part their ways. I am very depressed today, i just got word that my boss is not expected to live more than a week. For some reason i just keep thinking that people will soon pull out of it, and they never seem to.Cancer is so horrible, so horrible. From my family members to the very people that stay close on a daily basis, its all around us. I quit smoking almost four weeks ago and i am so proud of myself. Even though smoking is not the only cause of cancer, it decreased me by 3 times what i did have stacked aginst me. I plan on going and seeing him today and i am not sure if he even knows that i will be there, but it does not matter. Cancer as it may seem fast moving is like time standing still. The day you figure out that you have it. The day that you seem to not be as strong and a walk to the car will put you out. The day that you can no longer get out of bed anymore. The day that you fear falling because you cant get back up. And these are all days that all you can do is sit there and think about what you could have done, or what you have never done. This is the time in life when you start to figure out what life is all about, the little things are the only things that matter. All the times that you spent upset and angry over stuff that is absolutly silly.The flashbacks of when you were a child and the countless times that you smiled. This is where the old saying comes to the surface "Never take each day for granted". How is it that we hear those words and think strongly of living by them, but we always fail. We get mad at people that surround us, things that never go our way. How can we stop being this way? It should not take being there in the last complete stage of your life for us to figure out that the saying is true.

no time no time no time, and making only a few dimes. I really dont even have time to blog, but felt that i was letting a few down.My burn is almost gone and i am still on a steriod pack from that. Just in the nasty peeling stages of what seems to be sand paper heaven.The last week has been, well, hell. Its been crazy from one thing to the next and seems to never speak. I have seemed to dis-own everyone i know and still am far from sane, is that possible? Sure people stay crazy when they are alone, or is it being alone that makes them crazy? hey, how about it does not matter, eesh. My head has been spinning like a horrer movie gone bad and the throwing up feeling in my tumm tumm has ceased only bits.Have been nasty busy here at work and nasty busy at Petco, they feel that since i will be going out of town, they need to work me as much as possible till then. I will be leaving at 5pm when i get off work on Thursday (aheam, tomorrow).Jason,Mika,Isobel and Me are shooting off to Iowa. So the last couple of weekends i have somehow managed to get to the racetracks and damn i want to get back into it so bad. I have about 3 buds that race and i love to watch. This is where i need my supa-honda.I will try to be better about posting here soon, i will post some pictures from my trip! Eric called me and i was busy and said that i would call him back, and never did. ( i am an ass for that)I hope that he does not hate me for that. Thomas has semi been in contact,words on messenger and an e mail here and there. Chris in ARKDEL-has been really needing to talk to someone and i have not been there like i need too! Ed, damn you are offering one hell of a package! A spa is supa-nice and i have never done that before, pamper me, owww. no contact from Ken. Jason has been on the nerve brink, but slowly coming back to safty.(or maybe i need pills) ha. Painting has happened ( Went to Chris's funeral and coped with that pretty well, just did what i had to do. I miss an Eric conversation. I feel the need for a good ass kickin on the street (car wise) and just a bimp and coffee. Today is long, so long, and i feel that it will never end. I dont have to work tomorrow night at petco i will be driving with two dogs up North. UP NORTH, where the people are nice and well, just damn smarter. And i say that being from the South all my life, would like to grow up where my kids have a chance of being smarter than me. Need to practice with my camera, its pathetic how my skills are right now. I dont want to give up on this, i love it and want to maybe make it somewhere one day? Will keep my my honeys posted, or will damn sure try my hardest.....

This should really be a topic I care not talk about but I find myself doing it anyway. Girls today, what is up with them. Either they think there shit does not stink or they are weird, ya know like your 80 plus cat owner. Ran into a 16 year old girl yesterday that got attitude with me for one reason or another and had your potty mouth in front of her pops. Now sure, I have the potty mouth, but I have enough respect to not speak that way in front of the parents.I actually asked her if that was her father in front of her, and she replied with her snotty "I know all the answers" tone "YES", followed by the whole head roll. I replied "and your talking like that to him"? Then she proceeded to get back into the car as I realized that this girl that has bites for her tops and barely hair on her legs, is wearing what I saw in flip me and sex me magazine the other day. I went ahead and told her that she also needed to put some clothes on while she was at it. She was like 15 or 16 years old, ok, ok, I know if there is grass on the field you can play on it, but give me a break. As I pulled away and drove the rest of the way home I started to think to myself about how OLD I must have seemed to her, heh. Even though I am no short of 24, I must have seemed like her mothers best friend. I just think that times have changed and you don't need to show every inch of skin while you are going to the library.Leave things to the imagination, ok, now I seem old.But then again, how mature was I by proceeding to get out of the car to whoop her ass? (someone needed to show her) My new co-worker turns out to be from around Dallas. We were doing the simple chat today and she mentioned that her husband was working for a very good company and was laid off. He was laid off due to Out-sourcing, yup you got it, cheaper wages, so why not. They had to move back here and now he makes 30,000 less than he had, and now she is working. Mind you that she is working my old job that I knew I didn't make enough money. I felt bad, and will feel bad for those who are caught up in the "we will replace you for someone who will work for 50 cents an hour". There goes all the good quality ways of life, and every one starts looking at the "made in America" stickers on products a little more closely. Once again time will repeat itself. People take it to heart when people cant learn from their mistakes on a daily basis, but world wide, its just passable, what gives? I had watched a special on 60 min or something like that a month or so ago about out-sourcing to India. When you call customer service and you think you are calling down the street, you are really calling someone in India. They even have classes that they take for them to speak better english, is it to trick us, or to make us feel more comfortable on the phone, humm. Then i heard them speaking about the same subject today at lunch on NPR. How about the news just being plain scary in these days anyway. I have to work my second job tonight, yeah for me, but will be off tomorrow. Had some nasty storms come thru here last night and did some nice damage to some of our parks, and now i have to deal with insurance. Need to take more pictures and get familer with the camera better. Need a sno-cone and a good book. Need to get some painting done, and need to play on the playstation ( i sound like Thomas, ha ) Till then my reading friends....

*Shelle dances around* Its friday and my boss at my second job called me and told me to take the night off! Guess what, i think that i just might! That will give me time to play and move some more boxes into the new place!Blogger has little hidden places, and i found some today. GOOD NEWS! I got it, i got the house. Im siked and so ready to move in. I signed the lease tonight and did the "handing" over of the keys.Im so ready to garden and do the house up and make it wonderful. I cant wait to cook my first meal in the kitchen and introduce the dogs to it. They will love it for the central air and heat alone.I have the house and now im broke. But thats how it goes right? Good times ahead....It even has a studio out back so i can paint. And the landlords are nice as hell! Now here comes the hard part, moving.... Anyone have any good ideas on what can make a move go smooth? I have moved many people and moved myself a few as well, but its always a ride of sweat. I need the easiest way since i work too much already, and i will have little to no energy. I talked to Thomas for a bit today, his voice was very calming and i enjoyed it. Still no e mail from Eric, yeah i think im not getting one. Chris at work, i love his rides and he has an awesome smile. Calvin is finally coming around to normal. Chris in ARK, i need to call, CHRIS in Hawaii, you need to write me. No call from Ken, maybe he is done? Jason seems happier now that things are coming together. I need to buy a mattress, but had no idea they were an arm and a leg and some more of the other leg!The new furniture row over here has cheap and nice furniture, Good things happening there. There is a rug that i want there, and the sales guy was awesome. (from colorado)Im tired and i need to study, crap.... So i am also reading a new book....here it tis! urlLink Stupid White Men Its a treat, but i need to study instead of reading that!
